campaign.story:
Delirium is an intricate but modern deck, strongly inspired by the classic french playing cards...with crazy twists.
Delirium Courts
Delirium is deigned by Thirdway Industries, Giovanni Meroni's new brand of playing cards. Delirium was chosen as the official 2015 deck of the United Cardists forum.
NEW! - Delirium Realm Book
The Delirium Realm book contains all characters of the Delirium World with a short (crazy) story. Is printed on the better stock available (170g) and have a supershiny mirrored cover. 
One book is FREE if your reward is 4 decks or more.
You can add extra books to your reward adding +7$.
Delirium Prism Tuck box
Delirium Prism is the version of the Delirium Deck that will be funded with the first goal of 8k. The tuck box will be printed by Expert Playing Card Co. on a special prismatic stock which changes color at every angle. The stock is very bright and matte, and won't affect colors much (it's not holographic).
This stock is new, never used for a deck tuck box before.
The color scheme for Delerium Prism uses acid green and blue as the main colours. The crazy scene on the front of the tuck box depicts the Delirium King giving a speech, surrounded by his guards and his consorts. On the back there is a scene with the Delirium Gods of War.
Here is the opened Delirium Prism Tuck Box. 
 A rendering of the Delirium Prism with JoD card (Delirium Heavy Infantry)
 Another view of two Delirium decks, front and back.
The prismatic effect on the Tuckbox is just photoshop, the final result of the prismatic effect will be different.
Delirium Cards
Delirium courts have a classic vibe but crazy expressions. Here are some courts, aces and jokers. The inspiration of this deck is just a simple burraco deck by Modiano. I put all the cards on my desk and said "let's redesign this, my way."
Master finish printed bt Expert Playing Card Co.
And some pips and the card back:
I named the AoS "Sultano"; the ace shape is made by his turban.
Stretch Goals
8,000 - DELIRIUM PRISM FUNDED! // REACHED!!
9000 - Embossing on Delirium Prism // REACHED!!
10,000 - Custom Seal on Delirium Prism // REACHED!!
11,000 - Inner tuckbox printing on Delirium Prism //REACHED!!
13,000 - 1th Extra Card on Delirium Prism (55 cards)
15,000 - DELIRIUM INSOMNIA UNLOCKED! - A new Delirium Deck of 55 cards. Will include embossing, inner printing, foil and seal.
17,000 - 2th Extra Card on Delirium Prism and Insomnia (+2 different cards! Both decks will have 56 cards)
21,000 - 3th Extra Card on Delirium Prism and Insomnia (+2 different cards! Both decks will have 57 cards)
25,000 - DELIRIUM MISTERY (?) UNLOCKED
38,000 - Giveaway!
If we reach 40K or more, other stretch goals will be unlocked!
Random stretch goals can be added during the campaign.
Stretch goals LV ups
Delirium deck will improve dramatically every stretch goal. This means every backer (you) will have an incentive to share it to make it better and better. 
The more stretch goal we reach, the better and more precious Delirium will be. Don't be shy and share it everywhere! :)
Are you a proud backer? You can change your profile image of Kickstarter with those funny round badges. 
 Uncut Sheet
Delirium Uncut frames are colorful and crazy. 
Will be shipped unframed and are not signed. Some minor damages on the edges may occour (are unavoidable and can be covered withthe frame).
Size: 57.3 x 61.3 cm ( 22.5 x 24.1 inch) - Displays 54 cards
Signature Edition /// Now AVAILABLE! ///
Delirium Signature Edition comes with a new, customized white tuck box.
 The back is ready to be signed and numbered. 
 I also want make the green part with the character inside like a bubble, with a special soft resin. I am not 100% sure I can do it, however. If the effect will be different than expected, I will find another way to custom it with something unique. /// Also, the limited will be improved by extras, based on the level of the backer. /// 
The Limited Edition costs 50$, shipping included, only 50/60 will be sold.
If you want to get one, verify there is the 5000$ Limited Edition reward available and add +50$ to your pledge.
Of course you DON'T have to pledge the 5000$ reward, this is just a placeholder.
/// One important thing: remember, when I'll send the final survey to know what yours reward(s) are, to write me you have a PRISM LIMITED EDITION, and if your level is at least 3, what court you want to customize and eventually what name you want printed on it. ///
Please, watch update #6 to see all the complete informations on Signature Edition.
Delirium Insomnia
At the 15k stretch goal, the Delirium Insomnia deck will be unlocked. It will have all the previous features unlocked on Prism (inner printing, emboss, custom seal and +1 extra card.)
Every "Insomnia" card will be different than "Prism". More features on "Insomnia" will be revealed during the campaign.
If Delirium Insomnia is unlocked you can change your rewards from pure "prism" into split "prism" + "insomnia".
The Delirium "Mystery" it's a special edition that will be revealed if we hit 25k (the name won't be Mystery)
Want to add some items to your pledge? Check the table!
Just add the amount indicated in the table below to your pledge!
One last thing
 Please, share this project with your friends! Like it on Facebook, follow on Twitter. We also have a Pinterest and Instagram account.
Thanks to the United Cardists forum and eveyone made this possible.
Tweaks and modifications will be done during the campaign.
Delirium Deck is designed by Giovanni Meroni, from Thirdway Industries.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck will be printed with Expert Playing Cards Co. 
It's a standard procedure and should go smoothly. I have already worked with them for my Evil Deck, coming early 2015.
They have already seen all the Delirium layouts and have approved them.

I am located in Italy, and I can't do the fulfillment directly: I'm using a professional fulfillment center located in the USA, Lake Michigan Mailers. They have already shipped a lot of Kickstarter decks and have a lot of experience in this field.

Of course problems might happen. I can't control other people actions, but I'll follow every step of the process to avoid problems and I will keep everyone updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
NOIR Arts Presents
DEFUNCTORUM Playing Cards
Defunctorum playing cards are an original set of two decks which consists of 54 fully customized playing cards each. Design of decks is created by Roman Kotiv and produced by NOIR Arts.
First deck “NOX Edition” is represented as night deck and another one “DIES Edition” - as day deck. Also we have an idea about additional decks for this set, but let it be mystery at the moment. 
Defunctorum playing cards design is complete, and another stuff will be announced soon. The only thing that we need now - is to get your support here on Kickstarter, which is essential for producing these playing cards. Our goal is to get sufficient amount of money, required for these playing cards to be printed and delivered to everyone interested. However the more we raise – more inspired we will become to bring you awesome add ons and bonuses!
Most of answers you can find in FAQ section. Please read it first.If you have any other questions - feel free to contact us.

Playing cards will be printed using golden and silver metallic inks on high-tech professional equipment. Using such type of inks will allow us to get shiny effect of printed artwork.

campaign.story:
Bicycle RongoRongo and MOAI RongoRongo are original decks of American playing cards designed by Tomas Leszczynski (bio) in New York and produced by United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). The decks are independently designed and honors an amazing civilization of Rapa Nui (Easter Island). Printed with metallic gold.
Matifu was created to bring educational games to the market. Matifu means “sand,” or “sand dunes” in Swahili; the name was inspired by my devotion to crowdfunding and an amazing power of backers to change people’s lives.
DECKS UNLOCKED
Bicycle RongoRongo GOLD
Available in Pledges and as Add-on

Bicycle RongoRongo GILDED
Available in Pledges and as Add-on

MOAI RongoRongo GOLD Special Reserve
250 decks only. Available as Add-on with a reservation
    EEB | 50 decks | Oct 18 noon | $18 USA / $21 Int. | All gone!
    EB | 100 decks | Nov 2 | $19 USA / $22 Int. | process here   
    R | 100 decks | available later | $20 USA / $23 Int. |

Bicycle RongoRongo GOLD Hologram
200 decks only. Available as Add-on with a reservation 
    EEB | 50 decks | Oct 12 noon | $22 USA / $25 Int. | All gone!
    EB | 50 decks | Oct 15 noon | $24 USA / $27 Int. | process here
    R | 100 decks | available later | $26 USA / $29 Int. | 

Bicycle RongoRongo GILDED Hologram
200 decks only. Available as Add-on with a reservation 
    EEB | 50 decks | Oct 29 noon | $22 USA / $25 Int. | All gone!
    EB | 50 decks | Nov 6 | $24 USA / $27 Int. | process here
    R | 100 decks | available later | $26 USA / $29 Int. | 

------------
EEB – Extra Early Bird pricing
EB – Early Bird pricing
R – Regular pricing
DECKS LOCKED
The following decks will be unlocked when we reach certain funding levels:
Bicycle RongoRongo BLACK
MOAI RONGORONGO
Our deepest thanks to Tom at United Cardists for his amazing input in the past and during the preparation for this campaign. Featured on:
The World of Playing Cards features reviews of thousands of playing cards, from 16th century to the most recent additions from any part of the world.
Features:
300 first backers receive ALL pledged decks (including all add-on decks) signed on the tuck-box. If you prefer decks without a signature, you can opt-out in the survey at the end of the campaign.
All original illustrations
Limited KS Campaign Print for each deck
Gold Metallic ink 
Made in the USA: printed at USPCC United States Playing Card Company.
Embossed finish, often listed as Air-Cushion, Cambric, Linen or Magic; all the same terms for Embossed.
The deck of 56 cards including 2 Jokers, one card with a back design on both sides and one card describing RongoRongo glyphs featured on cards. The description of RongoRongo glyphs will be provided to the best of our abilities; many glyphs remain the mystery and the process of deciphering them is still ongoing.
Bicycle branded tuck cases with Embossing and Gold Foil.
It’s year 1300; the age of crusades slowly reaches its end in Europe. The population of Easter Island thrives. In five hundred years since their arrival, the people of Easter Island evolved into a highly organized society under the rule of the king wielding god-like power. Throughout the island large engineering programs take place, moving massive MOAIs to the edges of the ocean, surrounding the island in statues worshiping their ancestors.
The system of glyphs called RongoRongo is used to record the events; it may be one of the very few independent inventions of writing in the entire human history. Although the attempts of decode RongoRongo are ongoing for over two hundred years, it continues to evade code breakers and most of it remains a mystery.
Rapa Nui people are famous for their pride and independence. They continue to fight for their rights to the land on Easter Island which was taken away from them during the centuries of raids, a foreign company takeover of the Island and 1888 annexation by Chile. This project pays homage to RongoRongo scribes who created those amazing glyphs.
BLACK DECK
 RongoRongo BLACK Deck / Back
RongoRongo BLACK Deck / Queen of Hearts
GILDED DECK
 RongoRongo GILDED Deck / Back
RongoRongo GILDED Deck / Queen of Hearts
GOLD DECK

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I completed a large number of graphic design projects (please see bio), so I am very comfortable dealing with any printing issues. I completed another Kickstarter project "Rotary Wedge" fulfilling all pledges and learning quite a bit in the process. Depending on the size of pledges I may use a fulfillment center to ship all products to backers.

Fulfillment is clearly a difficult part of this project, as dealing with many packages and various orders is challenging. We will either use Stamp.com with their automated system or give the entire project to the fulfillment center if the size of the shipment overpowers our in-house capabilities.

The international shipping cost is difficult to estimate and it’s very high regardless of a carrier used. We will use United States Post Office for all shipments; we were very successful in the past shipping similar projects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This deck is a critique on the familiarity of certain symbols within our culture, & what happens when symbols converge. Undefined Knowledge, Inc. does not own the rights to any symbols or logos that our designs are a critique of, and the intent of this deck is strictly artistic expression.
 "A minimalist design -- with a subtle nod toward [super]heroic iconography..."
It was never our intent to create superhero court cards where a certain hero is the King, his girlfriend is the Queen, and his sidekick is the Jack. This wasn't about making a "literal" superhero deck, but rather a design experiment on what happens when certain symbols, like card suits, converge with equally iconic images.
The manufacturer we use lists the material as 310gsm French casino quality card stock with black core (linen finish). This is the same card production specs we have used on our previous successfully-funded projects.
Let's just call this our homage to that infamous "Death of... " story arc back in the Nineties. We are only printing 250 of these Limited Edition Black Decks, which includes alternative card backs, tuck box and an alternative Heart Suit design.
Hearts in the Black Deck will be Black and Red instead of Red and Gold, and the Heart Court Cards will be Black and Red instead of Red, Gold and Blue (see above). All other Card Fronts will remain the same.
One "Black Heart" Commemorative Button Pin will be given to each Backer that pledges for one of the Limited Edition Black Decks. It will match the buttons included in the Pin Set we will give away if we meet the first Stretch Goal (see below)!
Stickers
Backers of the Sticker Reward tier will get ONE sheet of pull-and-peel stickers with their deck. There are 8 stickers on a sheet, and these stickers are of a very high, water-resistant quality.
Dynomighty Wallet
Dynomighty began 10 years ago in NYC, (they're now in Brooklyn, just like us!) and have since become one of the fastest growing companies in the US three years in a row. The reason for their continued success lies in the open, collaborative environment they foster. "We crave ideas & innovation, and the best way to harvest those ideas is by sharing and listening to those around us." Dynomighty products are sold in over 60 countries worldwide, and we are happy for the opportunity to take our designs for this Kickstarter Campaign and offer an amazing Dynomighty Wallet as one of our rewards!
Exterior Design
The Mighty Wallet was designed by Terrence Kelleman in 2005, and has spawned an entire new genre of wallet made with DuPont™ Tyvek® fabric around the world. The Mighty Wallet was the first ever wallet made with DuPont™ Tyvek®, folded entirely out of a single sheet it even improves upon a standard leather wallet with its stitchless design. 
Whether you've backed one of our previous three projects, or this is the first you've heard of us, we just just want to say thank you in advance. Designing and making these cards, and getting to know the playing card and kickstarter communities has been an amazing experience for us.
Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:

After being successfully funded on our last three projects, we are excited to present this unique deck of playing cards. The feedback on our previous projects has been tremendous and we hope you enjoy this deck just as much as it's predecessors. One thing we have been deeply proud of, has been our ability to ship our decks all over the world, usually within a month of the end of our campaigns. People have been pleasantly surprised with the turnaround time on our projects, and we are dedicated to maintain our reputation.

Illustrated by David Edgerly, artist behind Edgy Brothers' Dia de los Muertos campaign, these decks recall the times we spent as kids in the world of fantasy role-playing games, or RPG's, where the knowledge of powerful sorcerers was contained in ancient texts, or Grimoires.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We recently completed our first campaign, Dia de los Muertos Playing Cards, and we've learned a lot.

First, everything costs more than expected. Between commissions paid to Kickstarter, Amazon and Backerkit, manufacturing the cards and Add-On items and shipping them to Backers all over the world, expenses can mount quickly. So, we've raised our funding goal to a more realistic number.

We've also learned how important it is to stay engaged with our Backers, answering their questions and listening to their feedback so a project can reach its potential. For Dia de los Muertos, we took notes from a few Backers that definitely improved the overall design. This campaign will be no different - we're going to stay active on the message boards and provide regular updates. And we want to hear from not just card collectors but hopefully hardcore RPG-ers as well, so that we can make these decks enjoyable for everyone.

We've also decided to keep our pledge tiers simple. Of course, Backers are still free to add to their pledges by purchasing as many Add Ons as they like - we just don't want the tiers becoming too complicated as that tends to complicate shipping, which slows things down. Faster shipping, happier Backers. Which brings us to...

...fulfillment. This is easily the most challenging aspect of a successful campaign. No matter how on schedule Creators are, the vendors' schedules are a different story. With Dia de los Muertos, we encountered delays from different manufacturers that were beyond our control. So, we've decided to be even more conservative this time and plan on completing fulfillment for this project in April. There is every chance we could fulfill earlier than that, but it's more realistic to plan on delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Campaign Cancelled; We Relaunch on Monday
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
Today we're canceling the campaign and will relaunch on Monday at Noon EST/9AM PST. We've flatlined after a great start and we think it's because we started with two decks. With "Dia de los Muertos", we started with one deck and no embellishments for $12 and a goal of $10k. The next two decks were unlocked as stretch goals. We were funded our first day and Backers kept coming; people just seem to pledge more to successful campaigns.
Apprentices, behold, the Elemental Magick Queen of Spades...Undine!

Noble Apprentices, no self-respecting Wizard would be caught dead without a familiar. So, we decided to provide the next best thing - a Grimoire Avatar for your amusement. Now, whenever you do anything on Kickstarter, other Backers can see your project pride. And know that you're not to be trifled with. You can right-click on any of these pics below and use them as you see fit:

updates.update_userinfo: Necromancy Deck Queen of Clubs Revealed!
updates.update_content: Noble Apprentices, behold: the Necromancy Queen of Clubs......Banshee!

Hail, noble Apprentices! Many thanks for undertaking this campaign with us, and discovering the secrets within the world of Grimoire! We plan for this to be the first in a three part series, totaling six decks in all. 
It's been a very promising first day, and we're thrilled with the early support. If you backed us on Dia de los Muertos Playing Cards, welcome back! You may have noticed we've set the bar higher this time in terms of funding. That's for purely pragmatic reasons; two decks with these embellishments and Add Ons don't come cheap, and 30k will at least get us in the ballpark. Shipping is always the wild card, but we think we'll be okay. Besides, we have our sights set on much loftier goals. And we promise to have a proper mock-up of our two coins soon - Coins for Anything was closed for business part of last week during the high holidays, and we just now were able to get that process going.

campaign.story:
Since the dawn of civilization, dark lore has been passed down through countless generations, haunting our thoughts, lending faces to our deepest fears. From the pages of the earliest written works to the screens of modern cinema, certain “monsters” have taken a seemingly immortal place in the psyche of our culture. The werewolf, the witch, the vampire, the Devil himself, and even abominations of scientific catastrophe... These familiar characters lurk about the murky troughs of legend and superstition. Our heroes burned them, pummeled them with silver, spoke curses, and drove stakes through their hearts. Yet time and time again they were resurrected, called from their caskets or raised from their ashes. These are the immortal faces of modern horror borne of ancient lore. Welcome to the world of Bicycle Eerie.
Give your rotting autumn season a spooky twist with Bicycle Eerie playing cards. These classical archetypes of dark legend will be right at home with the cool drafts and quiet spiders that lurk about the corners of your own little castle. Happy Halloween, All!

campaign.story:
Everyone knows dogs love to play poker. Now, they have their own deck of cards.
The playful designs tell a story with every card. Pack of Dogs Playing Cards feature a multi-breed cast of canine characters depicted as kings, queens, jacks and jokers all drawn with great wit and good humor.
Meanwhile, the numbered cards tell a different story all together, conceived with exquisite visual invention. Every suit sequence tells a story in pictures.
Here, a Boston Terrier makes his bed more to his liking.
A nose and two ears---1---2---3 spades per dog. Where's the tenth spade?
Fearless, faultless, faithful nostrils---at last, I've found my favorite fossil.
A nice, warm place on a wet and rainy day.  Nap time and a sequestered siesta.
Each face card depicts a stand-alone scene from a dog's life—from a Heroic Admiral to a Valiant Knight. All of these will be in this latest edition of the deck.
In this pair, one King is the picture of supreme vigilance. Likely the bite is worse than the bark. Dog Marley, a peaceful warrior laying down a nice, easy groove.
 This Canine Coquette, flutters and flatters her way to position of privilege and pleasure. A Heroic Admiral, raises his fork in Victory! Dinner's ready!
  Cossack Jack has slept all night on frozen ground and faced a thousand howling hounds. The Queen of Wieners prepares for another curtain call.
 A contented Queen, alone with her bone. The empress is the essence of imperial disdain. Too many hopes betrayed by ambition and intrigue has poisoned her soul. Revenge is the only dish that won't taste bitter on her tongue.
 A troubadour from Labrador and a salty sea dog.
 Love reigns supreme upon the throne with King of Hearts. His affable brother tips his crown to the crowd.
 A tattooed joker and another jester fresh out of jest...
Here are a few last minute add-ons:  Chose either a signed portrait of your very own hound as a royal card or yourself as a dog. Now, that makes it interesting!
These portraits are about 5" x 7" and done with ink and a brush. You can even submit a picture of someone else if you prefer. A one-of-a-kind item that would make an unforgettable gift for Christmas to go with a deck of cards.
Our tuck box has an engaging terrier ready to play:
After much deliberation and consideration, I settled on a new card back design which features the canine adage " don't wag your tail until you've played your hand". We needed a visually succinct design which was discreet and interesting, not too strong on contrast and complimentary to  the over all aesthetic of the deck.
I know the convention is to mirror the image on the back of the cards as well as the faces but I find that a design limitation that disagrees with me.
These two are going on the tuck box tabs. Gives the card cheats something to think about....
Taken all together, Pack of Dogs is a small box of treasure packed with Optical Nutrition.  And in case you're still a little hungry, here are a few other visual truffles which you can share with your friends....
PLAY

And...what?...there's more? Oh, yes there is. Hold for a dramatic paws...
This super-stylish neo-noir photo of a moment from our video "Don't wag your tail until you've played your hand" can be yours.  It's a gorgeous print in rich black and white and printed on a sleek satin finished paper. Every print is signed by the artist and comes with a Certificate of Pedigree endorsed by one of our stars:
We're putting our 54 card deck in the capable hands of the United States Playing Card Company to ensure the highest standard of printing and finish. Whether you're a card collector, appreciate great graphic design, a dog lover or just want them in your own hands, please join our campaign and tell your friends about us. Many, many thanks for taking a look at our project.
Release the Hounds!
 How to pledge:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a reliable partner in the United States Playing Card Company who knows their business and will deliver the highest-quality product. We've also done a thorough cost analysis of the fulfillment and shipping charges, both domestic and international, to minimize any surprises.

Fulfillment is the quicksand of any project and we have a sturdy bridge in place. The rest of the rewards (dog tags, coasters, prints and posters) are new vendors for us so we will make sure to keep our contributors aware of any delays on delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Calling All Hounds:
One of your fellow backers alerted me to a potential problem with the delivery of the packages.
He received a notice from the postal person that .35 cents postage was due on the parcel. He put the coins in an envelope and the package was delivered the next day. This is the first case I've heard of but I don't want anyone to wonder where their package is or have to scour your car seats or pants pockets for spare change.

Barkers One & All:
Some of you will have received your orders by now and I'm hoping your
happy with this newly minted deck of dogs.
Shipping and fulfillment is slow operation to make sure everything gets in the package correctly and sent to the right place. It challenges those of us who are not given to either high level executive function, disciplined and orderly sequential procedures or a general organized approach to solving problems. This is an operation of one person for the most part and it's me.

Dear People of Pedigree:
The first round of shipments is outbound and on it's way.
We're working from the top of the rewards list down to the bottom.
Those of you who ordered one or two decks will see your orders arriving by next week. Those of you who are somewhere other than North America will see your orders arriving within 10 days or so.

Devoted and Loyal Barkers:
Good news this week from the printers at USPCC: we're getting a January delivery of the new POD deck. This means, of course, you'll see your decks and extras very soon.
We will be posting more frequently now and keep you apprised of our shipping schedule.
JOHN

Barkers:
We've received everything from our various vendors but for one and it's the one that really counts.
USPCC says they're unable to deliver the cards before January 2015. 30 days is not too big a problem but it means those of you who we're thinking of these for giving at Christmas will be disappointed. I know I am. I don't want to either give or receive any more socks.

Devoted Barkers:
Since USPCC allows us 56 total cards in our decks, we took a moment to consider what these extra two might look like. The entire Lord of the Rings Trilogy in teeny, tiny type? How to pick-up chicks with some snappy, easy to remember lines in Esperanto? Maybe not.
We conducted a exhaustive survey of over 3 people and came up with these designs.

Devoted Barkers:
We're placing the orders for the drrink coasters and dog tags which some of you will be receiving as part of your rewards package.
On the coasters, there's a plaintive Boston on one side and a diligent terrier on the other. An attractive place to park your martini.

Devoted Barkers:
I've finally come around to a final design for the tuck box. Excruciating as it's been to get to this point, I'm happy with this version. I especially like a little detail I added at the last moment to surprise you when you open your deck. A friend of mine suggested I add another picture on the tuck box flap and I've added it here. If you look at the left hand illustration of the 3D rendering of the box showing the back of the box, you'll see a tiny pair of eyes above the Boston terrier's head.

More details are given in Update #1, but this will ultimately benefit the project and the backers, as well as allow room for the project to grow. If you're concerned about this change, feel free to send me a message and I can try to further explain why this decision was made. 
Important information regarding rewards:
Reward packages have been updated - make sure to view the image below to see exactly what you'll receive with each pledge level. For example, "The Works" packages will now contain TWO uncut sheets - 1 Standard and 1 Imperial. Also, multiple deck pledge levels will come with half Standard and half Imperial as default. However, you will have the option of selecting to receive all of either version instead, once the project ends.

This reward will include two signed and hand-numbered decks now instead of one signed and one unsigned deck.

Hey everyone - I wanted to shoot out a note to say that the relaunch of the Brew House playing card set is now LIVE on Kickstarter! Link is below.
http://kck.st/2l3M

Hey everyone - I wanted to let you know that the 1910 Brew House deck will be relaunching in February. I'll post more details before the launch, but just wanted to send out a heads up for now. The project will be greatly stripped down and the focus will be on the playing cards without the many add-ons. Pricing will be simplified and the goal will be set much lower. I really want this project to succeed this round so we can get these cards made. The decks will be the highest quality they can be from the get go - no stretch goals or other incentives.

Hey everyone,
I want to thank those who have supported this project so far. With this being my first project, I knew it would be a learning experience. With the funding unlikely to be met, along with wanting to change many areas of this project, I'm planning to go ahead and cancel so I can rethink and relaunch in the future. This deck will come to life one day, and I hope I can retain the support I've had from each one of you until that day comes.

campaign.story:
The Beginning
It all started with a trip to Thailand in September 2013 and stumbling upon the locally-made elephant pants. Nathan, in his state of excitement, purchased several pairs as gifts for friends back in the States and for his own personal wear. As you can guess, the pants were a huge hit for their comfort, ornate designs, and the resulting superhero feeling you'll experience while wearing them.  
After seeing the positive responses, Nathan decided to pursue something larger and began locking down elephant pants suppliers. With a supplier lined up and styles selected, Nathan enlisted the help of his business partner James and together they began forming the foundation of the brand, The Elephant Pants. The Elephant Pants bring you adventurous and stylish comfort that can accompany you on your daily journey. Wear them around the house, while running errands, on your way to yoga class, or out to the movies with friends.  
Now The Elephant Pants needs your help to bring these amazing pants State-side. With our goal set at $5,000, we will be able to bring six styles of elephant pants into the mix. As a "thank you" for being an early-adopter, we will be covering the shipping costs on all U.S. pledges being shipped out. Help us by pledging and declare victory for your legs.
Say No Campaign
For every pair sold we are donating $1 to the African Wildlife Foundation and their Say No Campaign. This campaign has been created to help bring an end to Elephant Poaching. In 2012 alone there were more then 35,000 Elephants poached for their tusks.
 Help us save some Elephants and get stylish in the process!
The Pants
The most comfortable and uplifting pants you'll ever own. The Elephant Pants are guaranteed to put a smile on your face and those around you. Our styles are authentic Thai designs coming in an array of designs and colors. The pants are made from 100% cotton. They are one-size-fits all with an elastic band on the waist and legs. Pockets are conveniently located on both sides and can easily fit a cellphone, wallet, or pair of sunglasses. 
The Styles
We are starting with six styles and bringing them here to the States. Each $18 pledge is for a particular style, so be sure you are pledging for the style you want! Scroll down to see the first six styles and declare victory for your legs #legvictory.
Black Diamond
 Raja
 Tarra
 Chunee
 Batyr
Ruby
Reward Packs
Thank you for your help! Be sure to share your elephant pants pictures with us on Instagram by tagging @theelephantpants
NEW STRETCH GOAL $7,000
Since you love The Elephant Pants we figured you would also love The Elephant Shorts. They're exactly like the pants just mini.  
If we can reach the goal of $7,000 we will launch The Elephant Shorts in all 6 colors we offer. 
 Here are the features: 
Elastic waist band 
Loose flowing leg holes 
2 easy access pockets 
Glorious Elephant print
Ready for delivery before Xmas
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a backer of our project, you'll have the joy of watching us grow The Elephant Pants into a thriving company. One of the key challenges in our project will be managing our supply chain and quality of our elephant pants. We have built a strong relationship with our supplier and will continue to strive for excellence in our quality and styles that we offer to our customers. 

Inventory management, timely order fulfillment, and customer service is always front-of-mind for us. Our background in the e-commerce fashion world (see www.bedfordandbroome.com) will help us make The Elephant Pants run smoothly and exceed our customers' expectations. With your pledge, our immediate needs to produce pants, create branded materials, and ship orders to customers will be made possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

You're excited? Feels these Elephants!
Please respond at the speed of an Elephant (25 mph). The sooner we have all of your info the better chance we have to ship your pants on time.

Amazing Ladies and Gentlemen,
You have done it! 
Due to your keen sense of style and generosity we will be able to bring you The Elephant Pants in the next few weeks. Black Diamond, Raja, Tarra, Ruby, Batyr, and Chunee can not wait to meet your legs.

Since you love The Elephant Pants we figured you would also love The Elephant Shorts. They're exactly like the pants just mini.
If we can reach the goal of $7,000 we will launch The Elephant Shorts in all 6 colors we offer. 
Here are the features:

We are beyond grateful for being able to announce we have reached 100% of the first goal!
This means two things:

campaign.story:
Hi! I'm Emmanuel, and I make paper-cut playing cards. My first 2 decks, Curator and Clipped Wings, were printed as actual decks by the US Playing Card Company. Together, we can turn my third deck, SAWDUST, into a real deck of cards.
SAWDUST shines the spotlight on the circus with 55 custom works of art. From onstage to backstage, the big show and the side show, the Sawdust deck brings the circus right to your hands.
The Sawdust deck will have a single print run. The guaranteed way to receive the deck is only through this campaign, so don't miss the big show!
PLAY

The video above shows the entire deck. If you'd like to watch it on YouTube, click here.
Click to enlarge.
Step by step creation of the 2 of hearts. Click to enlarge.
The Spades court cards form a triptych. The story changes when flipped. Click to enlarge.
The Sawdust deck will be printed by the USPCC with these features:
52 custom playing cards, 2 custom jokers, and 1 custom back design.
Poker-size dimensions (2.5 x 3.5 inches).
Bicycle Stock and Air-Cushion Magic Finish.
At the US Playing Card Company, all decks of cards are printed as uncut sheets before they are packaged. As an uncut sheet, the art of Sawdust is beautifully showcased, and it's sure to make an impression. Dimensions are 22 x 26.5 inches.
Example Only (not part of this campaign): Below are the uncut sheets of my previous decks. For availability of these decks, please see the FAQ at the bottom.
Example Only: My previous uncut sheets. Click to enlarge and see separate sides.
This hardcover collector's art book takes a closer look at the art of Sawdust. The book contains 32 pages and measures 11.25 x 8.75 inches. The books will be signed.
The art of Sawdust, Clipped Wings, and Curator are available as matte finish prints. Click here to see prints, their dimensions, and print codes. In the post-campaign survey, the codes will be used to indicate print selection. Prints will be signed.
A bundled price applies to the Sawdust clown triptych prints and the Sawdust jokers diptych prints. Please see Add-Ons section and FAQ section for bundled pricing. Click to enlarge.
Want more items? Please see the chart below and add the corresponding price of the item(s) to your current pledge amount. In the post-campaign survey, you'll be able to specify your add-on items.  * * * Please contact me if you have any questions! * * *
Facebook         Twitter         Google+        LinkedIn         Pinterest
Thank you so much for visiting the Sawdust Kickstarter page. If you're enjoying Sawdust, please spread the word, and thank you for the support!
Special Thanks to the following people for all their help and expertise!
Mark Simmons          Reesa Graham               Evan Ewing                 Emily Raw                             
Yuri Martinez               Gigi Nguyen               Tanuka Ghosh               Joel Jeske

The holiday season will affect the USPCC's turnaround time, but the Sawdust artwork has long been complete. This campaign has also been streamlined in consideration of any end-of-year delays. campaign.story:
This deck of playing cards is dedicated to all the blue collar workers who understand what it’s like to actually do an honest day’s worth of work. These are the men and women who earn their rights to relax with that cold glass of beer at the end of the day. This Bicycle deck was designed by Johnny Whaam. The fine detail of each hand drawn card is reminiscent of a hard working, manufacturing America.
Printed by the United States Playing Card Company on their classic air-cushion finish, each of these 54 cards features detailed, hand drawn, original art including a custom tuck case, custom pips, and a custom deck seal.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Bicycle Blue Collar Deck has already been approved by USPCC for printing. We expect to receive the the decks by January 2015 and immediately begin shipping to all our backers. We do not anticipate and challenges with this project.

The Bicycle Panthera Deck which is currently funding and has surpassed it funding goal is already in the printing stages. We are expecting to ship these rewards a month ahead of schedule!

The Bicycle Physique Deck will should complete shipping by the 2nd week of September.

The Disruption Deck is in the late printing stages and will ship on or before schedule.

How do we print and ship out rewards so quickly? We have a close relationship with USPCC. They are able to print our designs quickly and we have a state art fulfillment center to quickly ship out our backer rewards. With out you, our backers, we could not make this happen. A BIG thank you to Kickstarter and most importantly all of you!

Mike
Collectable Playing Cards

campaign.story:
If you just saw this Kickstarter project but would still like to purchase the AVES Playing Cards, visit luxplayingcards.com.
Thank you everyone for the wonderful support of this project!
Follow us at twitter.com/luxplayingcards for further updates and info on new projects!
The name for the deck, "Aves" comes from the proper scientific classification for birds. "Aves" is also Latin and Spanish for "Birds."  These fine art playing cards were hand drawn by a world-class artist before being turned into digital art prior to being transformed into gorgeous playing cards, just for you.
The Aves bird deck will be printed by the USPCC (United States Playing Card Company) on magnificent Bicycle card stock.
Karina Eibatova is the artist for this deck, and she spent months illustrating this. She studies nature, including birds, and from her efforts has come an absolutely stunningly elegant natural bird deck. Karina is an illustrator and fine-artist, born in Leningrad, USSR (St. Petersburg, Russia), and is currently based in Vienna, Austria.
Artist Karina Eibatova
Karina specializes in drawing, illustration, murals, video, calligraphy and typography. She has had exhibitions in St. Petersburg and Moscow, Russia, Gerlesborg, Sweden, and Vienna, Austria. She is 1 of 3 people in a creative artist group called the Dopludo Collective.
Some of her other clients include: Sunday New York Times (USA), Wired Magazine (England), Iloveyou Magazine (Berlin, Germany), Monsterthreads (Sydney, Australia), and Atlantic Records (USA). She recently completed painting a mural inside a luxury hotel in Barcelona, Spain.
Bicycle AVES Deck Playing Card Features: 
Printed by The United States Playing Card Company
Bicycle® branded
Hand drawn and designed by artist Karina Eibatova
Deck produced by LUX Playing Cards
100% completely custom designed cards, including art, pips, royalty, backs, everything.
Custom Tuck Case with textured linen cover
56 cards including a full 52 card deck, plus 2 Jokers, a LUX card, and a double backed card.
Normal sized poker deck of playing cards.
Linen finish. Also known as Air-Cushion finish for fine handling.
Printed on premium Bicycle card stock.
Artwork inspired by birds of nature.
The tuck cases are amazing. We wanted the cards to be held in something as stunning as the cards themselves, so we are using a unique textured, linen cover for the tuck case, which reminds me a lot of the lines and hatch work on the Madison Rounders / Dealers tuck cases. The raised texture on this tuck goes really well with the theme of the deck.
 The nests in the corners are part of the 2 small side flaps that fold down under the initial opening. Each part of the tuck case is being used to show off the art.
The card back is extremely detailed, and features feathers from many bird types tied together with a beautiful, one of a kind coordination. The cards fan really well with this colorful, elaborate design. Even with a large picture, the intricate designs are amazing.
There is amazing attention to detail on each different royalty card, all of which are illustrated by hand.
The level of sophistication on the illustrations is incredible. You won’t know whether to play with them or hang them on your wall.
This Bicycle playing card deck will feature 56 cards, including a full 52 card deck with 2 Jokers, a LUX ad card, and a double-backed card, all carried in a unique textured linen finished tuck box.
The United States Playing Card Company has already approved the artwork, so this deck is ready to fly into your hands.
The Aces are striking. You’ll see they still carry the Bird theme while retaining a unique individuality.
This is my second playing card deck to produce, and the first one successfully funded here on Kickstarter. We waited to launch this deck until the first playing cards - The Illusionist Deck - had shipped.
Thank you for helping to make this deck of playing cards a reality. Please share this project on Facebook and Twitter so that others can share in this beautiful art.
Pips - 4 of a kind.
 Below are a few pictures of the hand-made LUX leather playing card holders. They each hold one deck of cards, as seen in the photos. There are only a total of 12 of these: 6 red and 6 chocolate brown, so when they're gone, they're gone!
 Special anodized aluminum card cases are also available as an add-on. You can simply add $9 to your existing pledge, and you can choose either the black or gold versions. They are light-weight and will protect your cards from almost anything. Only 100 total of the special anodized aluminum card cases were made of each color.
 Wooden Coins
Instead of a metal coin for this project, we wanted to do something more in touch with this playing card deck, so we are going with custom engraved wooden coins. These 2 inch diameter wooden coins are absolutely amazing in their detail. Each wooden collector’s coin is laser engraved for the highest possible resolution.
Wooden Coins Set of 5 Complete
I’ve even added the tip of a pencil to a picture to show you just how detailed the engraving is on these wooden collector’s pieces, which can also be used as a dealer coin when playing poker or card night.
  The coins come in a set of 5: the Swan pictured here (Queen of Spades), as well as the Peacock (Jack of Hearts), Penguin (King of Clubs), Owl (King of Hearts), and Pelican (Queen of Diamonds). You would simply add $30 on to your base pledge to have us ship this 5 collector coin set to you. The back of the coins are represented by the 4 different card suits in their own unique Bird designs, plus a coin made up of 2 feathers represented on the tuck case and card back design.
Original Art, 1 of a kind. Signed by artist.
The original art would look great in a 5 inch by 7 inch frame. The suit designs (Diamond Feather, etc) are smaller by nature than the birds, but are still amazing in their detail.
Pelican and Diamond Feather with Ruler
Uncut Sheets are available as an add-on. An uncut sheet is approximately 26 inches by 22 inches, and it is the printed sheet of cards that is pulled from the rack before it was cut into a deck of cards. It is a great display piece. One side has the card backs while the other side has the front (faces) of all of the cards.
Art prints of any bird design are also available as an add-on. Art prints are 14 x 22 inches, and finished on a linen stock, so they'll look amazing. Make sure you get one of these amazing fine art prints for yourself or for a friend.
To manage your pledge, just add-on an additional dollar amount to your base pledge if you want Add-on items from below. You will receive a survey at the end of this campaign so that you can detail what your pledge was for, and you will receive any extra items that you want (wooden coins, extra card decks, uncut sheets, art prints, card deck holders, etc.) Thank you!
Add-Ons
Bicycle branded playing cards have the Bicycle logo across the front of the deck, as in the pictures above. Unbranded cards do not have the Bicycle logo across the front. Having different tuck boxes is a great way to show off the art.
Below is a video on How to Manage Your Pledge for add-ons.
 http://vimeo.com/67736084
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second playing card deck to produce, and the first one successfully funded here on Kickstarter, and shipped on time. :)

This Bicycle Aves deck is being manufactured and printed by The United States Playing Card Company (USPCC) and the artwork is already approved, so there should be close to zero delays or risks with this project. We don't foresee any production delays, but if they happen, we will keep everyone updated and work through it. We will put all of our efforts into fulfilling everything in a timely fashion. 

We will always be transparent and open with you. It's our highest priority to have everything in your hands as quickly as possible!

updates.update_userinfo: Aves shipping complete and new deck launching :)
updates.update_content: Hey everyone!  This is a double-feature update.  First, all of the AVES shipping is complete. Thanks for everyone who backed the project. The entire journey has been amazing, and I wouldn't have been able to do it without all of your help.  I am always happy to hear how much you like the cards; any comments are always sincerely appreciated. If there is anyone who needs an updated tracking # or has questions, here is my personal email address: luxplayingcards (at) gmail.com - I am always ready to help in any way possible, and I've truly enjoyed this project.

Hey everyone! I appreciate all of your support and compliments so far on the cards.
This is just a quick note to let you know that fulfillment and shipping for the Aves Bird deck is still ongoing. There are 780 backers, and great care is taken to ship each deck of cards. Also, shipping outside of the United States does take some time. As you know, it can take weeks to receive something. We are working around the clock to make sure everyone receives their orders ahead of time.

Surprise! :)  The Aves bird deck playing cards are printed. How awesome is that!?! We are way ahead of schedule! I have been very efficient working with USPCC, and they have been fantastic as usual. I am so excited to see these final cards in-person, and I will continue working to have these unboxed from USPCC and shipped to you ASAP. :)
Action Required if you have a new address: If you have moved since you completed your Kickstarter survey, you can edit your address for the next 48 hours.

Hey everyone! Just wanted to give another update as to the production on the Aves playing card deck by USPCC (Bicycle)... Everything is going great! Last week the next steps were taken in the process. USPCC has already been paid, the contracts have been signed, and we are in the queue to be printed, all as expected. We had an initial February date for shipping everything, and I think we will be ahead of schedule once again.
I'm looking forward to sending these out to everyone... after all, we have more luxury custom playing cards on the way!

Hi everyone! So I've got some good news and some... good news.  :)
1. The surveys have been sent to you. If you haven't already completed your survey, please do that now. We need your address so that we can mail you these beautiful Aves Bird playing cards once USPCC has finished printing them.
2. I've been working diligently to have these cards printed as quickly as possible, and YES we have already received the proofs from USPCC! They look fantastic. I am still amazed at the artwork every time I see it.

campaign.story:
RongoRongo Playing Cards printed by EPCC or USPCC. We will print shorter runs at EPCC; we may move to USPCC for larger volume print.
RongoRongo is an original deck of American playing cards designed by Tomas Leszczynski (bio) in New York and produced by either EPCC at Conjuring Arts or United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). The deck is independently designed and honors an amazing civilization of Rapa Nui (Easter Island). Printed with metallic gold.
RongoRongo decks are available through any deck pledges and as add-on. When pledging for RongoRongo decks you don’t need to specify the color of the deck: we will ask you to select the color at the end of the campaign.
Limited edition decks (only 500 printed) MOAI RongoRongo are available as ADD-ON only. Please register on our backers' site to see the availability, then process Kickstarter add-on payment after receiving a confirmation email from us.
MOAI RongoRongo Limited GOLD: REGISTER AND MORE INFO HERE
Special Reserve edition decks (only 250 printed) MOAI RongoRongo are available as ADD-ON only. Please register on our backers' site to see the availability, then process Kickstarter add-on payment after receiving a confirmation email from us.
MOAI RongoRongo Special Reserve GOLD: REGISTER AND MORE INFO HERE
Matifu was created to bring educational games to the market. Matifu means “sand,” or “sand dunes” in Swahili; the name was inspired by my devotion to crowdfunding and an amazing power of backers to change people’s lives.
Our deepest thanks to Tom at United Cardists for his amazing input in the past and during the preparation for this campaign. Featured on:
The World of Playing Cards features reviews of thousands of playing cards, from 16th century to the most recent additions from any part of the world.
We are at the top of Playing Card project on Kicktraq Playing Cards Hot List.
We are at the top of Kickstarter Staff Playing Cards list sorted by popularity
 Max Playing Cards in English and in Spanish
Features:
300 first backers receive ALL pledged decks (including all add-on decks) signed on the tuck-box. If you prefer decks without a signature, you can opt-out in the survey at the end of the campaign.
All original illustrations
Limited Print
Gold Metallic ink 
Printed at EPCC at Conjuring Arts in New York City (the actual printing takes place in their Asian factories). If pledges exceed $45K we may move printing of some or all decks to USPCC United States Playing Card Company and place "Made in the USA" on these decks.
Master Finish at EPCC; It is the same finish as the Exquisite and Heretic decks.
If we move to USPCC, we will use Embossed finish, often listed as Air-Cushion, Cambric, Linen or Magic; all the same terms for Embossed.
The deck of 56 cards including 2 Jokers, one card with a back design on both sides and one card describing RongoRongo glyphs featured on cards. The description of RongoRongo glyphs will be provided to the best of our abilities; many glyphs remain the mystery and the process of deciphering them is still ongoing.
Goal
We are setting a goal of $15,000 based on a minimum print requirement for EPCC: 1,000 decks of the first color and 500 decks for any additional color. If we reach the goal of $15,000, almost all funds (after 5% Kickstarter fees and 3-5% Amazon fees) will be used for printing decks and shipping of all pledges.
$1 BIRDMAN SPECIAL
$1 pledges will be released on certain days between 12:01 PM and 1:00 PM EST. Mike Kabala was crowned the BIRDMAN during our first campaign and he will be granted the power to decide the exact time of the release by posting “Release the BIRDMAN SPECIAL Now” in the comment section. If we don't hear from BIRDMAN we'll release the special at 1:00 PM.

Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of all add-ons you have chosen.

It’s year 1300; the age of crusades slowly reaches its end in Europe. The population of Easter Island thrives. In five hundred years since their arrival, the people of Easter Island evolved into a highly organized society under the rule of the king wielding god-like power. Throughout the island large engineering programs take place, moving massive MOAIs to the edges of the ocean, surrounding the island in statues worshiping their ancestors.
The system of glyphs called RongoRongo is used to record the events; it may be one of the very few independent inventions of writing in the entire human history. Although the attempts of decode RongoRongo are ongoing for over two hundred years, it continues to evade code breakers and most of it remains a mystery.
Rapa Nui people are famous for their pride and independence. They continue to fight for their rights to the land on Easter Island which was taken away from them during the centuries of raids, a foreign company takeover of the Island and 1888 annexation by Chile. This project pays homage to RongoRongo scribes who created those amazing glyphs.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I completed thousands of graphic design projects (please see bio), so I am very comfortable dealing with any printing issues. I completed another Kickstarter project "Rotary Wedge" fulfilling all pledges and learning quite a bit in the process. Depending on the size of pledges I may use a fulfillment center to ship all products to backers.

Fulfillment is clearly a difficult part of this project, as dealing with many packages and various orders is challenging. We will either use Stamp.com with their automated system or give the entire project to the fulfillment center if the size of the shipment overpowers our in-house capabilities.

The international shipping cost is difficult to estimate and it’s very high regardless of a carrier used. We will use United States Post Office for all shipments; we were very successful in the past shipping similar projects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi BackersBackers,
First of all a huge thank you for staying around after update #10; I am humbled by such a vote of confidence and I am truly grateful to see such support.
A few days ago USPCC revised their long standing policy of minimum requirements from 2,500 decks to 1,000 decks. That changes everything. Projects like this one, which required $8.5K per one deck just to break-even, can now be moved back to the USA and printed at their state-of-the-art facilities.

campaign.story:
A deck of playing cards inspired by the Native American's.
Gaming has been apart of the Native American culture since the beginning of its time. The Chumash people often played two styles of games, one involving chance, and the other skill. The ancestors of the Chumash often would even place bets on the outcomes of these games as well.
Each village had a special area in which these games were played, they called it Malamtepupi. With this in mind we have shortened the name to Malam, and merged it with one of the most notorious items used in the current age of gaming and created Malam Playing Cards.
The Gold Foil Box.
Back Design, Ace of Spade and Joker.
We used extreme detail on the faces of the cards, creating gorgeous court cards and beautiful pips to create a deck you would be proud to own. The backs of the cards we took a simple approach while still maintaing some of the detail, using a tomahawk and building around it. 
Spades Sample
Then there are the Aces..Many people raved about the Aces on our Believe Playing Cards, so we carried that over into this deck, creating another extremely detailed set of Aces. Using inspiration from such items as dream catchers and tomahawks, we put together what we believe to be our best set of Aces yet. 
Diamonds Sample
All of this with our custom Feather pips, created a true piece of artwork you can carry in your pocket at all times. 
We are honored to bring you Malam Playing Cards!
Hearts Sample
Clubs Sample
TWO DECKS? 
We made two versions of this deck..One being the Deluxe Edition, the other is what we call the Standard Edition. 
Deluxe Edition:
The Deluxe Edition comes with all the bells and whistles, custom court cards, custom pips, custom aces and in a beautiful box, with gold foil printing and embossing. 
The Deluxe also come with a Custom Seal. 
Deck Seal for Deluxe
Standard Edition:
The Standard edition keeps the deck simple for those who may want to use the cards for such things as Magic, and not draw to much attention to the design. This version includes The Box, with with gold foil printing and embossing, the custom Ace of Spades and the custom Court Cards. All the number cards have standard pips. This way you can still have beautiful design while still keeping the integrity of a standard pack of playing cards. 
There will also be no Seal for the Standard Edition. 
Standard Number Pips
Standard Diamonds
Standard Hearts
Standard Spade
PRINTING: 
We teamed up with Bill Kalush and the wonderful folks at Expert Playing Card Co. We will be using there Classic Finish, which is above standard of another big name company we wont mention..They also assure our cards are perfectly cut, so you get a beautiful box, all the great custom elements and  wont get misprinted borders!
T-SHIRTS: 
Why not look fresh with your new deck, with these awesome T-Shirts! Add on either Red Back Design Tee or the awesome White Spade T-Shirt! 
Spade T-Shirt
Back Design Tee

campaign.story:
MINT deck unlocked!  $16k stretch-goal reached!
 Now that we've reached $16k in funding, the second color deck - MINT is now available!  Inspired by money, the cards feature green, black and metallic inks on an ivory background.  Packaged in a charcoal and silver tuck box, with a new ornate front graphic.
All backers pledged for 2 or more decks have the option of replacing up to half of their Original White decks for Mint.  (For example: pledge for 4 decks and receive up to 2 Mint decks with 2 White decks.)
Four Point Playing Cards is an original deck of cards designed by Ben Vierck. Drawing inspiration from the intricate designs of money, ancient symbols, impossible geometry, and yoga mudras; the original art was illustrated by hand. Each court card, ace, joker, card back and box illustration are offered on Kickstarter as rewards to help fund the production of the deck. Designed in San Francisco and made in the USA, this top-quality deck is manufactured by the legendary United States Playing Card Company (USPCC).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've spent the last 6 months researching, designing and sourcing this project. However, obstacles can arise unexpectedly. Potential set-backs include production delays or sourcing issues. That being said, I feel extremely confident in the suppliers and the conservative timeline I've chosen. As an experienced industrial designer, I've brought many complex products to market on time.

updates.update_content:
All the Four Point Playing Cards rewards have been shipped. The majority of packages were sent last week, with the final few going-out this Monday, December 15th. By this time, many US backers have started receiving their decks. International orders will take longer, depending upon location and time in customs. Please feel free to contact me directly with any questions or concerns.
I would like to give a special shout-out and thank you to my girlfriend Makenna, who worked tirelessly to help package and ship over 500 orders. It was quite a week.

Shipping
The US Postal Service picked-up the first batch of orders earlier today. I will be shipping every day this week, and barring any major obstacles, all orders will be in the mail by next Monday (December 15th). This means that every U.S. package and the majority of International packages should arrive before Christmas. We are working long days and nights to get everything out as soon as humanly possible.
NOTE: Uncut Sheets and Print Posters will be shipped in tubes separate from the decks. If you've ordered an uncut sheet or poster, please look-out for 2 packages - a tube and a small box.

I'm pleased to announce, that after a year of culmination - I've received the decks from the US Playing Card Company! Yesterday was spent breaking down the two pallets (and 1,500 lbs.) of cards now currently occupying most of my living space!

Hi All,
I'm happy to report that the project is still on schedule for delivery before the December holidays.
The tucks are made and the USPCC is printing the cards this week.  I'm adding a little something special to each deck, stay tuned for more details.

Hello Backers!
Everything is proceeding according to schedule, and the final design and production details are shaping-up nicely.
Surveys

Hello Backers!
Funding closes: Saturday, August 6th at 8:00am (Pacific Standard Time).
As the project's funding window closes in less than 2 days, please make sure your order is correct before the deadline.  It will become final.  Make sure your total pledge amount reflects any "add-ons" that you want.  Please message me directly with any questions you might have, by clicking "Contact Me" on the Four Point Playing Cards Kickstarter page.
Surveys

Hello All,
I'd like to thank you all once again for bringing this project to life!
Mint-Edition Uncut Sheets Now Available
For those interested in a Mint-Edition uncut sheet, feel free to add one to your order.  Please add for U.S. backers or International.  This is an actual deck of cards, hot-off the presses, and uncut.  Measuring approximately 22" x 26-1/2", the item is unframed and will be delivered rolled.
We've reached $16k in funding, and the MINT deck is now available!

Hello All!
One of the unexpected surprises of this project has been connecting with a community of people through Kickstarter.  During the course of the project, I've engaged with some great creators stumbled upon some interesting projects.
There's a ton of great projects out there, here's a couple that I've recently backed myself...

campaign.story:
-- THE ART -- THE ARTIST -- THE DECK --
"NEWTROPOLIS & The Fantastic Fur" includes 56 unique pieces of original artwork from celebrated U.K. Playing Card Artist, Peter Wood. Peter has drawn decks for many different companies over the years including not only Newt's Playing Cards, but also US Games and Piatnik.  Just shy of 20 have been published and another 30+ have been created as part of or one offs for various collectors worldwide.  We are proud to continue the legacy with this unique, Limited Edition deck of cards that includes your normal 52 cards plus 4 jokers...all drawn by Peter Wood.
This Kickstarter campaign features a LIMITED EDITION, numbered deck of cards that takes you on a journey that is reminiscent of comic book heroes of the past.
Can you find all the hearts?
Here are a few words from Peter Wood:
-- WHAT MAKES THIS DECK DIFFERENT  --
-  Strict Limited Edition run of 1152 decks of cards or 8 cases.
-  Numbered Edition, Gold Colored Decal or label on each deck.
-  Printed design inside of the tuck box.
-  Decks will sell for $12 plus shipping after shipment arrives.
-  Uncut sheets will ONLY be available here on Kickstarter.
-  If we print a "normal", retail deck it will not include bonus jokers, labels or foil back (if stretch goal is met).
Limited Edition Label/Decal
-- WHAT IS SEMI-TRANSFORMATIONAL ART --
This type of art isn't really new as it has been around since the late 1800s.  As the video states multiple times, at NewtsGames.com we just happen to love this type of art so much that we continue to create more decks with it.  In the "old days" this type of art was called "semi-transformational" but we like to call it "hidden images" or "seek-n-find".  "Semi-transformation" just means that the suit signs or "pips" are hidden in the picture...which is exactly what these decks do.  They are 'transformed' in a subtle and fun way just like they did back in the late 1800s.
Can you find the hidden clubs?
-- THE STORY BEHIND THE DECK --
"NEWTROPOLIS & The Fantastic Fur" Is the latest deck of cards created by UK artist Peter Wood exclusively for Newt's Playing Cards!  Peter has always been a huge fan of comic book superheroes and remembers reading them as a young boy a 'few' years ago.  Likewise, he loves to draw teddy bears.  Together, this deck features Peter's "Super Teddy Bears", straight from his own imagination.  While he freely admits that some are parodies of famous comic book heroes and villains, most are inspired from every day life.
Similar to some of our other decks like "WILD!", "Cats - Pips-N-Paws" and "Busy Bears", Peter has created "NEWTROPOLIS & The Fantastic Fur" in the same semi-transformational format. At Newt's Playing Cards we often call them "seek and find" playing cards to help folks better understand what the deck is.  The basic scoop is the deck has hidden Pips (hearts, clubs, diamonds and spades) on each card.  As an added dimension Peter has also hidden the symbol of Newtropolis, a hexagon, throughout the deck.
Can you find the hidden diamonds?
-- WHAT IS NEWTROPOLIS? --
NEWTROPOLIS is the main city of Hugobia (The Land Of Bears).  What makes this city so unique is not the buildings or it's location, but many of it's inhabitants. NEWTROPOLIS is the home of a host of powerful and very special teddy bears who have a vast range of special powers. Some are gained from unique circumstances, some from accidents and some from years of dedication to their craft. These 'Super' bears are joined by their desire to rid Hugobia of all evil and wrong.  They are divided into 3 main 'factions': The Diamonds, Hearts & Clubs.  They are all connected in their battle with evil via BRAIN (Ace of Clubs) who has the mental ability to contact anyone at any time and read their minds whilst planting his own thoughts within his subjects heads. All is not well in NEWTROPOLIS! Although the 'good' bears in Hugobia derive much of their energy from the honey combs pure honey, there is a mutant strain of this food that was infected many years ago - some say deliberately. For those bears that eat from this source it eats away at their more positive traits and has created the villain 'Spades', which are the sworn enemies of NEWTROPOLIS.  They also have a wide range of bears with special powers of their own.
And so the battle for NEWTROPOLIS begins. Heroes versus Villains.  Good versus evil.  One lovable hug at a time...but who will win?
Oh, and you better watch out for the "Joker" bears.  Who knows what side they align with!
Can you find all the pips on the Jokers?
 -- ABOUT THE CARDS --
The decks will be printed by one of our regular manufacturers in China.  The quality of the deck is very important to us.  Over the years we have worked with various suppliers in other countries and the couple that we use now provide the best service and excellent quality products.
Here are basic details of the decks:
- 300 gsm (10pt) stock
- Block out core to make sure cards can't be seen through
- 56 cards per deck (52 Normal, 4 Jokers/Wild Cards)
- Poker Size (2-1/2 x 3-1/2)
- Matte, Linen Finish
- 4 color front, 4 color back, 4 color tuck box - 300gsm (10 pt stock)
- Shrink wrap around tuck box
- Print INSIDE of tuck box.
-  INCLUDES LIMITED EDITION DECK SEALS or numbered labels on all of the decks!
Can you find all the spades?
 -- OTHER DECKS BY NEWT'S & PETER WOOD? --
Newt's has been publishing decks of cards for almost 15 years now.  Usually small "Indie" style runs.  While we have done quite a few decks with this semi-transformational style art.  We have also published political cards, other forms of art and historical decks.  As collectors we ended up taking our passion for collecting playing cards to a much larger scale and it has been a blast.
Other decks of cards drawn by Peter Wood and published by Newt's Games & Puzzles.
Shown above you can see some of the other decks we have published with artwork done by Peter Wood.  There are actually a couple of "rewards" you can get to help fund this new deck and get some of the others too.  It's a great way to add to your collection.  One of the reward levels is for the last 12 known decks of the "Chamber of 52 Cards" which is a limited edition deck of 500 decks worldwide.  Before we launched our first KS campaign there were more of these, but now we are down to only these 12 because quite a few sold on our site.
  -- CARD BACK DESIGN --
Keeping with the tradition of "hidden pips", our card back features a honey comb design with various flourishes and the "leaders" of the Good and the Evil bears.
Card Back Design for NEWTROPOLIS & The Fantastic Fur
 We've just enhanced the "HONEY COLLECTORS 12 PACK"!  Now it not only includes some of the limited items we have on some of Peter's artwork, but there will ONLY be 5 of them available.  Basically because that is all of the uncut sheets we have of Genesis and Pips and Paws.  So far we have not found uncuts of any of the other decks.
VERY Limited Quantities!
So if you want to collect pretty much everything we have from Peter Wood, then this new level is for you.  We are even going to get Peter to sign the others decks we've printed!  So you'll not only get a signed copy of NEWTROPOLIS, but also of WILD!, Pips and Paws and Busy Bears.  We will leave it up to you if you want us to open the Genesis deck and have it signed or not.  The uncut sheets in this reward level will NOT be signed.
~~  S T R E T C H    G O A L S ~~
1) Reach $2,500 = The FIRST 50 Backers whose pledge is $40 or more will get a FREE deck of Peter Wood's other deck of teddy bear playing cards called, BUSY BEARS.
2) Reach $3,500 = The black areas on card back will be printed with FOIL.  This is similar to what you see on various collectible card games but instead we will do it on the card back and they are playing cards.
3) Reach $5,000 = We will make a standard retail edition available.  A minimum of 1,000 decks from the run of the retail deck will be donated to hospitals to be given out to children who are diagnosed with diabetes.  No foil back, no printing inside tuck box.  The jokers will include information or artwork to encourage children and parents. Backers can increase their pledge at a rate of $5 per deck (international add additional $3 per deck for shipping).  If you wish to sponsor some of the decks given away you can do so and just let us know.  Retail price on our site for this normal edition will be $6.  Here on Kickstarter you will not be able to order this retail deck without backing the limited edition first.
4)  Reach $8,000 = The Limited Edition tuck box will be embossed.
5)  Reach $13,000 = The "Retail" decks will be printed by US Playing Cards.  If this happens some of the art will change slightly as USPC is unable to print the deck as designed.
-- ADD-ONS --
After thinking this through more, we have chosen to not offer add-ons with this campaign at this time.  This campaign is all about this unique deck of limited edition playing cards and the goal of being able to create one that includes info on diabetes.  Basically, we want to stay dedicated to what we know best, playing cards.  So if there are any type of add-ons we will keep it playing card related or at a minimum related directly to Peter Wood.
PLEASE NOTE:  Images shown are meant to be a mock up to help you better understand the basic design and/or layout. As we work to fine tune this project the art may look different on the final product.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The art is complete. There may be tweaks on the art as we go along. Delivery date is set for January of 2015 just to play it safe. Some of the signed decks will take a little longer to deliver as we live in the US and Peter lives in the UK.

We do the shipping ourselves as we are already used to shipping orders from our eCommerce site. All of your Kickstarter orders will be imported in to our site and tracking numbers will be sent from there once your decks ship.

Our first goal is to raise the minimum amount needed to complete the project and fulfill all rewards. Our dream is to reach the 3rd stretch goal which is a minimum of $5,000. At that point we will create the diabetic retail version of the deck too. We will be donating a minimum of 1,000 of the retail decks for children diagnosed with diabetes.

We print a minimum of a couple dozen different decks of cards every year and have become accustomed to the playing card process. We have a close relationship with our manufacturers who have consistently been producing decks of cards for us for several years. The quality of the product is of utmost importance to us as a company, and as a playing card collector.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
