campaign.story:
These Jokers will only be in the Gold Edition and will not be put in the Bicycle branded deck. There will be Gold metallic ink for the corner symbols as well as the "Joker" title. Once the funding reaches $25,000 these jokers will be unlocked.
 I’m excited to introduce a deck of cards that has not only stretched me artistically, and has taught me a lot about our nations history, but also has become a project of passion.
The idea for this deck started with my kids and their love of trains, joined with my wife's ability to recall random history lessons from school and a theme began to emerge.  As I thought about the strong images that came to mind when you think about the big steam engines, I knew I needed to find a topic to carry the theme that was just as big!
Golden Spike Playing Cards are inspired by the completion of the 1st Transcontinental Railroad On May 10th, 1869. It was the first rail line that connected the east to the west and revolutionized transportation and commerce in a post Civil War United States. A Golden Spike was created as a commemorative piece to celebrate the completion of the 1st transcontinental railroad and was driven into the ground where the Union Pacific met the Central Pacific Railroad at Promontory Point, Utah. When the hammer rang out and the golden spike was driven into the ground, a new era of industry and expansion rang out across the United States.
Each playing card deck has been illustrated using a cross hatch technique to mimic the style of engraving and lithographs that were common to the time period.  Each card has been researched and given ample time to create and refine each illustration.  
Take a closer look! Click on the links below to see a detail view:
Golden Spike "Bicycle" Tuck Box
Golden Spike "Bicycle" Card Back
Features:
Printed by the United States Playing Card Company
Each court card, Ace and Ad card will have original illustrations, capturing the feel of the era and the major players in the creation of the 1st Transcontinental Railroad 
Original Art for the Jokers and ad cards which will not be available in the Golden Spike "Gold Edition" deck 
The tuck cases will have original illustrations and depict the Central Pacific train “Jupiter.”
There will be an Ad card that will give the names of the characters
Take a closer look! Click on the links below to see a detail view:
Golden Spike "Gold Edition" Deck
Golden Spike "Gold Edition" Back
Features:
Printed by the Legends Playing Card Company 
Each court card, Ace and Ad cards will have original illustrations, capturing the feel of the era and the major players in the creation of the 1st Transcontinental Railroad 
Original Art for the Jokers and ad cards which will not be available in the Golden Spike "Bicycle" deck 
The Tuck case will be printed on the highest quality card stock and have Gold foil embossing and Gold metallic ink
The tuck case will have an original illustration that depicts the Union Pacific train “119.”
The Black Suites will have gold metallic ink for the Pips and Index symbols
The Red suites will have red metallic ink for the Pips and Index symbols
There will be an Ad card that will give the names of the characters
Full catalogue of cards and the history behind the characters will be available during the campaign.
Backers will have the opportunity to choose the design for the final extra cards. Updates will follow during the project.
How to get your Add-Ons:
1. After you have pledged to the project there will be a blue Manage your pledge button on the right hand column as seen above.  
2. Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. Unless you want to change your tier at the same time, Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at. If you do change your tier, just add the total of add-ons to your new tier level. (If you are an international backer, please be sure to pledge the international amount)   
3. You then have to confirm your new pledge amount and will be sent to Amazon for checkout completion! 
4. Important! Be sure to message me about your add-ons so I can be sure to mark it down! It creates a lot less confusion at the end.
Thank you to my team: 
Lisa Eklund - My wife, writer, and partner
Chad Parker - Video Editor and project advisor
Andrew Bartels - Deck collector and project advisor
Christian Sass - Fellow artist and artistic counsel
Volant Angel - Card collector and project counsel
Jason "CBJ" Rideout - Card collector and project counsel
Mike Ratledge - Card collector and reward advisor
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have done a lot of research and put together a great team of people to ensure that this project goes as smoothly as possible. There may be unforeseen obstacles that may arise, but I have prepared by surrounding myself with a knowledgeable team of people, and a healthy dose of personal research to minimize any problems. The delivery date is a conservative date in order to make sure the production of the cards are not rushed. As a designer, illustrator and consumer, I know that it is necessary to have a high-end product and I am committed to delivering the best product possible.

campaign.story:
From the artist:"In the heyday of kings, a mysterious force swept over all of the kingdoms possessing the rich, powerful and wealthy causing a Blackout- Forcing the kings to rule their kingdoms blindly. The poor, however, were not affected by this mysterious force. The wealthy and powerful had no choice but to become united with the poor against this force to save their kingdom."
"Some people believe that the mysterious force was the eyes of the Demon but others believe that it was the watchful eyes of the Gods."
With your pledges, Blackout Kingdom will become the third deck release from Gambler's Warehouse. 
About Us
Our team at Gambler’s Warehouse are passionate about playing cards, exquisite design and cardistry. Having roots in Las Vegas, Nevada and now Dallas, Texas; we have been a part of the playing card industry for over twenty years.
All of our products are designed in house and we have a reputable history of quickly delivering quality products with excellent service.
Bicycle Branded Blackout Kingdom Deck
BLACKOUT KINGDOM BICYCLE BRANDED DECK FEATURES
56 Sleek Playing Cards manufactured on Quality Bicycle® Stock Paper using the same processes as the world's leading playing card.
Custom Face Cards, Court Cards, Jokers and Tuck-Box 
Printing by the United States Playing Card Company Collector's 
Limited Edition - Limited Print Run Air Cushion Finish
Mettalic Silver Foil on Tuck
TUCK BOX & CARD BACK
Card Back Design 
Custom Courts, Jokers & Pips
Unbranded, Gold Limited Edition with Sideways Tuck
BLACKOUT KINGDOM LIMITED EDITION FEATURES
56 Sleek Playing Cards Custom Cards - Including Face Cards, Court Cards, Jokers and Tuck-Box 
Limited Print Run of 1500 Decks
Linen Finish
Metallic Gold Foil on Tucks
 Card Back Design
**NEWLY ADDED DECK 7/22**
Limited "Light Shade" Edition Blackout Kingdom Deck
ONLY 1500 to be printed. Will never print again!
JUST ADD $15 to your original pledge to receive this deck.
 Custom Numbered Seals
ADD ONS
Blackout Kingdom Card Clip/Case
Absolutely stunning card cases made from 100% aluminum and engraved with the Blackout Kingdom Logo. These card cases are guaranteed to last a lifetime and serve as the perfect protection for your collectable Blackout Kingdom playing cards.
Blackout Kingdom Poker Chips 
Hight quality, casino-grade poker chips featuring Blackout Kingdom Courts.
 Full Poker Set in Luxurious Wood Box
A luxurious Collectors wooden 2 deck case with engraving and a full set of Blackout Kingdom Poker Chips.
Blackout Kingdom (Business Card Size) Bottle Opener
This handy dandy bottle opener is great to have on hand for your next party, card game, or simply to keep in your wallet for unexpected "I can't open this beer" occasions.
**NEW 3 DECK LUCITE CASE! (US BACKERS ONLY)**
PRICING: ADDING ADDITIONAL ITEMS

campaign.story:
LAST 9 HOURS - ONLY 15 DECKS LEFT!
We're in the last 9 hours! Help us find homes for the last 15 decks! We've added fancy custom poker chips to the project in five difference colors, here's how you get them:
RED - Every backer gets a red chip regardless of their pledge! Get an extra as a $2 add-on.
BLUE - Share the project on facebook before the project ends, and you'll get a blue chip as well! Or get as a $2 add-on.
BLACK - Refer a friend to back the project, and you'll get a black chip as well! Or get as a $2 add-on.
WHITE - Help us find a home for the remaining 50 decks! Add on another deck or prototype deck in the last 60 hours and you'll get a white chip! Cannot be purchased as an add-on.
GOLD - Only comes with the GOLD DECK reward. Cannot be purchased as an add-on.
Introduction. 
Royalty. Dinosaur royalty. Last week archaeologists in Argentina uncovered the fossils of Titanosaurus, the largest dinosaur ever found. To celebrate this discovery, we present to you Royal Dinosaur Playing Cards, a deck of cards presenting dinosaurs with the nobility and prestige they deserve. 
Render of the Kings.
Render of the Queens.
Render of the Jacks.
Render of a few of the number cards.
Render of card back.
Render of the tuckbox.
NEW - Elite Sleeves!
Dinosaurs not aristocratic enough for you? Well, we know how to fix that. Introducing Elite Dinosaur Sleeves, an add-on that will just add to the eliteness of your deck. Each sleeve is hand crafted and uses heavy cardstock and metallic gold foil to make your deck even fancier than before. 
Elite Dino Sleeves demonstrated on a standard bicycle deck!
Want Elite Dino Sleeves for your deck? Here's how to get them:
Add $4 to your pledge for each sleeve you'd like OR add $12 to put sleeves on every deck in your order (no limit)! 
Details.
We hope you will make this print of 500 decks a reality. Each deck is given the utmost care. Heavy 310g stock, linen finish and trusted printing will be used, producing high quality cards. Each card is detailed and features original dino-artwork. We can't wait to get them into your hands for a closer look!
A closer look at the Queen of Diamonds.
Every deck will come with a signed certification card -- certifying the deck's place and number among the 500 deck print -- and a draft card, a hand drawn pencil concept for a possible different style we were thinking about.
Render of Certification and Draft cards.
 We will be posting the Aces as the project progresses -- we hope you'll like them! We will be using the MPC to print our cards, we have seen for ourselves the quality they deliver, and are excited to be using them.
Fancy rewards.
We've got a slew of fancy rewards to pledge for. Each of them is hand-made with high quality material. Check them out!
Render of the framed tile reward.
What's this? A framed tile? You were thinking about a print of one of the cards but you thought, "It's royal, but not royal enough -- I prefer my artwork to be waterproof!" Well this is the thing for you! Any card of your choosing printed on a ceramic tile and framed in a nice cherry frame. 
Wood certification card with the first fifty decks and upper tier rewards..
 Need to plot your next dino adventure? What better way to do it than in dino notebooks? The "Deck + Notebooks" reward tier gets you a pack of four.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is a strong community of dino-deniers out there who would like to see a deck such as this hidden from the public. Don't worry. We are well able to deal with such treachery and will work to assure that -- if we reach our goal -- we will provide each backer with excellent quality and communication.

We have a printer ready-to-print and have many years experience fulfilling orders and shipping products. The only piece of the puzzle left is to reach the goal. Thanks for your support, we hope you enjoy the deck as much as we do!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Friends,
It's been a while since Dinocards, and I hope you've enjoyed your decks as much as I have! I have two exciting new projects which I want to alert you to.
The Periodic Table of English Writers

ATTENTION FLOCK:
Rewards are shipped! We spent the last several days packaging and packaging and packaging some more and now everything is nice and snug in our local Brooklyn street post office. From here, it's up to the USPS. You should be receiving your packages within the next two weeks.
There are a dozen or so people whose rewards we've had to hold onto for a few more days, but those rewards too will be shipped soon -- we'll let them know by message if there's a delay of more than a day or two.

STEADY AS SHE GOES

We've officially received the last package, and shipping day is upon us! Quality-checking is underway, and so far it looks like we'll have packages out to the post office today that should ship out tomorrow.

We will continue to update you as the next few days go on!

campaign.story:
Muertos is an original set of American playing cards designed by Steve Minty and produced by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). It is independently crafted and honors the holiday that celebrates life and death; Dia De Los Muertos. The Muertos deck takes the classic aesthetics of Dia De Los Muertos and is updated with the tradition of playing and my experiences growing up. It depicts the social classes and history of the culture while simultaneously giving off a contemporary elegant luxurious feel.
150k Unlocked!
Color Deck Un-Cut Sheets!
Each is signed by me! The price remains the same as the other un-cut sheets ($25 for Domestic, $40 for international). I know it's very last minute but I wanted to offer something that would be cool! I will only make enough of these to fill orders and nothing more. Don't worry if you can't pledge for it now, it will be available in backerkit!
125k Unlocked!
 Now every back with at least 1 pledge of each Color Deck (Love Deck, Celebration Deck, & Sun Deck) will receive a pair of Red Love Dice and Celebrate Dice free of charge! This is a highly exclusive order and the dices will not be available for add-ons or swaps.
Dealer Button!
New dealer button that will be free with the 100, 300 & 500 Poker sets. Each dealer button is made from Acrylic and is approximately 4"x3". This dealer button is not available as an add-on!
 Optional Poker Chip Denominations!
Backers with the 100, 300 and 500 Pokerchips Set will now have the option of either getting their chips in non-numbered denominations or numbered denominations! The collector's set will still retain the non-numbered denominations. When you add a 100, 300, or 500 Poker Chip Set, message me your choice of either numbered or unnumbered denominations!
Enhanced Suit Design!
Numbered cards will now have updated suit designs to enhance visibility and functionality!
Different Backs for Color Decks vs Night Decks and Mourning Gold Decks!
  Back designs for the color decks (Love Deck, Celebration Deck, Sun Deck ) will have a similar yet different design. The design integrity remains the same but certain details have changed. This increases variety and value!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I grew up in Los Angeles and at a very young age, I was exposed to a lot of different cultures, especially that of the Mexican heritage. There are many aspects of the culture that I become accustomed to, but it wasn’t until I started looking into my fear of death that I was introduced to the holiday known as Dia De Los Muertos. The imagery and symbolism of Dia De Los Muertos is incredibly beautiful and has a lot of whimsy and playfulness to it despite it involving the very somber topic of death.
My goal when creating the imagery for the Muertos deck is to honor the message that Dia De Los Muertos celebrates. From Aztec influences to José Posada’s works and even the Mexican-American Wars, I aimed to capture the social classes and implications that are set within the history of the culture. By encompassing all of it and expressing it in my style and my background, I feel it’s true to me and a product I am very proud of.
In the next couple of weeks, I hope to get work with you to release more awesome rewards and make Muertos come to life together!
Muertos Night Deck back design
Muertos Night Deck Aces
Muertos Night Deck Spade Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Padre, La Hermana, El Soldado
Muertos Night Deck Hearts Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Catrin, La Viuda, El Bandito
Muertos Night Deck Clubs Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Caudillo, La Bailarina, El Campesino
Muertos Night Deck Diamonds Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Azteca, La Catrina, El Caballero
Joker cards feature the Calaveras (sugar skull) and the Muertos Insignia.
The pips on numbered cards has been updated to a design that reflects the symmetry of traditional decks but is new and refreshing. 
Muertos Queen of Clubs - La Bailarina
Muertos King of Diamonds - El Azteca
Muertos Tuck Box Layout and Layers

The Muertos Night Deck come packaged in a black and grey embossed box featuring gold foil accents, and a grey tax stamp seal.
Muertos tuck box grey seal
Once $40,000 Stretch goal funding is reached, the limited Muertos: Mourning Gold Edition will be unlocked as an add-on.

Once $60,000 Stretch goal funding is reached 1 additional Mourning Gold Edition deck will be free for all backers with 3 Night Decks or More! Additional International Shipping for this extra deck will be on me!
Muertos Mourning Gold Deck
Muertos Mourning Gold Deck Ace
Muertos Love Deck
 The Muertos Love Deck is based on the blood that runs in our veins. They say that Blood is thicker than water and so is the love of family. Dia De Los Muertos brings family closer together to honor the dead and I couldn't help but use that as my source of inspiration.
Add the Muertos Love Deck for $15  
($17 for International Orders.)
Muertos Celebration Deck
The Muertos Celebration deck is based on the vibrant fun decorations of Dia De Los Muertos. From Papel Picado to Flower decorations, I looked to them all as a source of inspiration. These decks will be Kickstarter Exclusives!
Add the Muertos Celebration Deck for $15  
($17 for International Orders.)
Muertos Sun Deck
 The Muertos Sun Deck is based on the gifts of Marigold and the sky. Also known as cempazuchitl, cempasuchil or zempasuchitl, Marigolds are used during Dia De Los Muertos so that your deceased loved ones can find their way back home.
Add the Muertos Sun Deck for $15  
($17 for International Orders.)
Unlocked: Golden Muertos Seal Stretch Goal
Update: Golden Muertos Seal has been unlocked! 
When the project reaches $20,000, each tuck box will come with a gold custom seal with grey accents. 
Muertos Engraved Wooden Poker Chips
Instead of doing common ceramic or plastic poker chips, I decided to go with wood. The tactile feeling of engraved wood is great on the senses and is sure to stand out from the rest. These poker chips come in 3 sets, 100 pieces, 300 pieces, and 500 pieces.  Each denomination is made from a different wood type: White Ash, Cherry, Walnut, Mahogany, and Purple Heart. The 100 set comes with the first four denominations, while the rest comes with all five. Each set comes with an elegant polished wooden engraved case. Only 10 of each set will be made and will come with a numbered certificate of authenticity. Once it's gone, it's gone forever!

Add a 100 set for $250. ($285 for international orders.)
Add a 300 set for $500. ($545 for international orders.)
Add a 500 set for $750. ($800 for international orders.)
Now available! Muertos Poker Chips Collector's Set. Each set comes with 1 chip of each wood type + 1 Hardwood engraved display!

Add the Muertos Poker Chips Collector's set for $25
($35 for International Orders.)
Muertos Poker Case
New Reward Add-on! This beautiful wood engraved poker deck case holds 2 signed decks. 
Add a Poker Case for only $75.
($100 for international orders.)
Muertos Wooden Deck
  I don’t believe this reward has been done before, but I am very proud to offer this reward to the $500 and $1000 level backers. The cards are exquisite and feel remarkable in your hands. 
Due to the nature of wood, inconsistencies may occur.
Now Available! Muertos Black & Gold Dice
Add a pair of dice to any reward for only $5
($7 for international orders)
Now Available! Muertos Marbled Ivory Dice
 Add a pair of dice to any reward for only $5
($7 for international orders)
Stay true to Dia De Los Muertos with the In Memoriam Pledge.
Pass on the legacy of your loved one by having a custom Muertos Style portrait on an extra card that comes with every Muertos Night Deck. Only 1 available.
Black “Muertos” Tshirt (Available in S,M,L,XL, XXL).
Add a “Muertos' Tshirt to any Reward for just $15.
($20 for International orders.)
11” x 17” Muertos Hand-Pilled Screen Printed Poster. Numbered and printed on high quality paper stock.
Add a “Muertos' Poster to any Reward for just $20. 
($30 for International orders.) Frame not included with prints.
Antique Gold 1¾” Engraved Commemorative Coin can be used as a dealer button, card guard, display piece, or decision maker. The front side features the sugarskull and the back features the Muertos insignia.
Add a Muertos Coin to any Reward for just $10.
($12 for International orders.)
Once funding has reached $30,000, 1 Muertos coin will be free for all backers with a pledge of 3 decks or more!
How to get your sweet add-ons:
1. After you have pledged to the project there will be a blue Manage your pledge button on the right hand column as seen above.  
2. Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. Unless you want to change your tier at the same time, Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at. If you do change your tier, just add the total of add-ons to your new tier level. (If you are an international backer, please be sure to pledge the international amount)   
3. You then have to confirm your new pledge amount and will be sent to Amazon for checkout completion! 
4. Important! Be sure to message me about your add-ons so I can be sure to mark it down! It creates a lot less confusion at the end.

campaign.story:
Traina Design’s Borderline playing cards feature bilingual designs that depict the unique culture and colorful characters seen in and around the US/Mexican border.
Borderline: Add some más picante to your poker night
The Borderline deck was lovingly hand-crafted by Traina Design in sunny San Diego, and showcases the colorful culture and characters along the border in our backyard. The deck arrives in a stunning, custom-designed, copper-foiled box that captures the frontera spirit and inspires envy in opponents.
26 richly illustrated characters bring every game to life
Borderline includes 56 playing cards, with face cards featuring 26 unique characters that capture the rich personalities from both sides of the border. Instead of the typical kings, queens and jacks, there are bikers, luchadores, Hollywood starlets, Mexican señoritas, small town sheriffs and federales. All our colorful characters turn the average card game into an unforgettable trip across the border.
The Borderline Camiseta
Get your very own Borderline T-shirt featuring an iconic longhorn car illustration on the front and crossed six-shooter pistols on the back, reminding people that you are not one to be messed with. Available in S, M, L, XL. American Apparel 100% cotton.
Collector's item: the Borderline press sheet
Act fast and claim your limited edition, uncut press sheet of the complete Borderline set of playing cards—signed and numbered by the team at Traina Design. Frame not included.
Add-ons
Due to popular demand, backers can add additional funds to their pledge and receive more products. If you decide to add-on, please send us a private message noting how much you added onto your pledge and which of the following extra items you would like to receive. We will confirm add-ons once the campaign is fully funded. 
+ $12 for 1 additional deck
+ $20 for 1 t-shirt
+ $30 for 1 uncut sheet
Thank You
Thank you for supporting Borderline! We are very optimistic that with your help, we will reach our goal and get this unique deck printed by the United States Playing Card Company.
Keep in touch
Stay up to speed on future projects, 'like us' on FB.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The design of the full deck and box is complete and final. The photos seen here are from a prototype we created. Actual cards will be printed by the US Playing Card Company, and may vary slightly due to their printing process and requirements. For example, the cards will be printed on a denser paper stock, the profile of the box may be slightly thinner, and colors may appear richer than what is seen in these photos. We will make every effort to ensure that the changes and discrepancies are minimized from what is shown. 

Uncut Sheets: These ship unframed. We will take every precaution to safely pack these, however minor scuffs, scratches, or creases may occur at the far edges of the sheets. These blemishes are unavoidable and are typically covered after item is framed/mounted.

Thank you!

campaign.story:
Hello! Thank you for stopping to look at our project! We are Peter Dunham and Linnea Gits, the designers and artists behind the Chicago design studio, Uusi and we are excited to introduce our project to you: an entirely hand-drawn deck of Limited Edition Playing Cards called "Hotcakes."
  "Hotcakes" is the fifth deck in our eventual six-deck series that began a little over two years ago. With every deck we have created for our series we try to push the boundaries of what this genre has seen. No two are the same in style, medium or theme, but all are created using traditional artistic methods. Whether using the Fine Art medium of oil paint as we did with our Pagan deck, or the expressionistic, colorful washes of gouache that gave Bohemia its signature look or, rubbing soft pastels over color pencil to add a velvety look and texture to our first deck Blue Bloods, our goal is always to create a unique style and theme for each deck.  With "Hotcakes" we reached for the most spontaneous medium in our art tool bag – markers! 
Following in the historic, playing card tradition, our Ace of Spades is always the title card for our decks.  With Hotcakes we wanted to give it the same saucy attitude of the court and felt nothing could be more fitting than two naughty cherubs!
True Hotcakes Fools! Our courting Cock and his bashful Hen add just the right amount of old-fashioned, "awe-shucks" charm to this racy little deck.
Our Diptych Ad Cards are unique to Uusi. We were the first designers to develop a diptych for playing cards and used it for the first time on our "Royal Optik" deck. The diptych was originally inspired by cards of transformation decks, that when pieced together form a larger image. We feel they add an original, artistic flair to what otherwise would have become a throw-away set of cards in the deck and bring the perfect last touch to the uncut sheets.  
Nothing but a borderless, lacy back would be right for Hotcakes! The "tighty-whitey" borders have been thrown off for a full-pattern reveal. The hot-neon magenta design makes for an eye-popping fan and a flush of excitement on every deal.
Ooh la, la! Our Hotcakes tuck is royally good fun.  A hand colored bustier barely covers this buxom nobel's treasured assets and is printed on luxurious, uncoated, premium paper stock. The design is unzipped in the back adding the perfect, naughty hint at what's inside. 
Our Limited Edition, Hotcakes "Modesty Sleeve" keeps all this cheekiness discreetly hidden with the beautiful Hotcakes back pattern printed on very heavy paper stock– the perfect cover to protect and hide a deck of misbehaving royals! These LE cases and decks will not be cello wrapped, they will be vellum wrapped together with a special, Hotcakes seal.
NEW UPDATE: BY POPULAR DEMAND MODESTY SLEEVE AVAILABLE AS AN ADD-ON! FOR THE SLEEVE ONLY (BLACK OR RED) ADD $12 TO YOUR PLEDGE. 
 Vellum Wrap and Oversize Seals for Hotcakes Modesty Sleeve Decks
*All images of the deck and tuck boxes you see in these photos are prototypes made at Uusi's studio. The finished product may vary slightly from what you see here – backers will be kept up-to-date of any minor changes that may occur. The overall design and theme will remain UNCHANGED throughout the funding and printing process. 
 Our inspiration for Hotcakes came from traditional 17th Century, full figure court cards that have a cartoonish flair and lent themselves easily to a burlesque-style exaggeration. This new and "naughty" court was then mixed with the Pop Art era's hot-neon colors, Andy Warhol's playful illustration style, the one-off art decks of Charles Pry and the distinctive quailty of the Italian designer & artist, Emillio Pucci's gorgeous patterns to arrive with the final look of Hotcakes.  
Using a one-way court does make Hotcakes more of an "art deck" for us than all our other decks, but we were very careful to keep the deck as playable as we could. We made sure – as always – that our indices are large and easy to read when held in your hand, as are the small suit symbols below them. As product designers, creating a deck of playing cards always means keeping a very strong emphasis on the "playing" – we want you to have a deck that is not only pleasing to look at, but one that you can enjoy and share playing any of your favorite games with your family and friends. 
Fifty-two playing cards and two jokers – all with original, eye-catching artwork that makes them ideal for magic and card games, yet at the same time very familiar and immediately recognizable by players and spectators alike.
Two illustrated Uusi Ad Cards that form a diptych. 
Printed by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). *All our artwork has already been pre-approved and is ready for print.
Limited Edition of 5000 Black decks. 
Printed on Bicycle Playing Card Stock with an Air Cushion (linen) finish.
Heavy, premium paper for the tucks and a bit heavier paper for the sleeve.
Each deck we create is a labor of love. We put an enormous amount of time into designing these unique decks and rewards as we truly want you to have something of value to enjoy for years to come – as will we! The Kickstarter experience has introduced us to people from all over the world, like yourself, who share the same passion we do for this humble item. You have enriched our work and our lives with your generosity, your own stories and invaluably helpful suggestions. 
We have been producing Limited Edition decks for over two years now and with each one we maintain a high level of artistry and continue to raise the quality of the overall product. On Hotcakes we have sustained that tradition with our premium grade tuck, deck and rewards.  We truly love creating these decks and are grateful to a community of backers who have supported us and allowed this series to come into the world. We couldn't do it without you!!
HOTCAKES SINGLE DECK ADD ON – $11 EA. (INTERNATIONAL BACKERS ADD $1 PER DECK ADDED).
HOTCAKES MODESTY SLEEVE ONLY - ADD $12 PER SLEEVE.
HOTCAKES COLORING BOOK - $32. Because we know you wanna. Full color cover with black and white line drawings of the Hotcakes court on the inside. All our Hotcakes royalty will be fully rendered with added artwork that will be unique to this book on every page. Pour yourself a glass of your favorite drink, splurge on the super-sized crayon set and let yourself feel like a kid again!  
Hotcakes Back & Front Cover
Hotcakes Coloring Book Exlibris Page
Hotcakes Coloring Book Inside Page
HOTCAKES CUSTOM PRINTED, LIMITED EDITION BRICK BOX: We have created a very special, extremely limited, custom printed box for this project.  Each one will be signed & numbered and holds 12 Hotcakes decks, (Modesty Sleeve not included on decks in brick).  
HOTCAKES UNCUT: With every deck we have made we create an extremely limited, never to be offered again, edition of uncuts.  This is not a poster, but an actual sheet of cards pulled from the press immediately after the print run.  Each uncut backed will be signed and numbered and comes with two Hotcakes decks.
LIMITED EDITION HOTCAKES HOT-YELLOW, EDGE PRINTED DECK: A Limited Edition run of neon yellow edge printed decks. Each deck in this run is hand bushed with high-pigment ink from Germany.  Only fifty LE Decks and fifty RED decks will be made for this project. Decks will not be cello wrapped, but wrapped in vellum with a special "Hotcakes" seal. 
HOTCAKES ONE-OFF ART SUITES: Hand-inked and colored by the artists on heavy, archival paper – each drawing is a unique piece of art. This is an extremely rare chance to get original drawings from the Uusi team behind the cards, Linnea Gits & Peter Dunham.   The One-Off suite of drawings includes one large format hand-inked and colored court from the Hotcakes deck and one of the Ace artwork. 
Court One-Off Drawing overall dimensions: 11" x 16" 
Ace One-Off Drawing overall dimensions: 9" x 10"
Hotcakes Ace Of Clubs One-Off Artwork. (Painting on right is by Anna Kunz)
Hotcakes Queen of Clubs Artwork Detail.
Hotcakes King of Clubs Artwork Detail.
With every project we create there are a handful of people to whom we are especially grateful for lending us their skill, talent and generosity of time and spirt that enhance the look and feel of our project in the following ways:
Martin Nelson Video Editing martinnelson.com
Tyler Mallory Cinematographer www.tylermallory.com
Don Boyer Magician and Playing Card Consultant
Liz Dunham Copy Editor liz.dunham@outlook.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Peter Dunham and Linnea Gits have been designing products for the market for over eight years. As designers and as consumers we understand the need for delivering a high-quality product, represented as accurately as possible and shipped on time. We have had five successful projects on Kickstarter with over 6000 backers total. We completed four of our five projects on schedule and shipped to all our backers in the US and around the world within our promised delivery date, with a 99% satisfaction rate. Our fifth project, "Pagan," was successfully funded on December 21, 2013. Printing is complete on that deck. We are waiting to receive it and will begin shipping it withn the goal date set on our project. We are committed to delivering a great product on time that you enjoy. Your happiness is our business!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I am proud to introduce Rock 'N' Roll playing cards. As a huge fan of rock, but with zero musical talent, this deck is my way of paying tribute to Rock 'N' Roll. 
For those about to pledge for Rock 'N' Roll playing cards, we salute you.
Each suit represents an era of Rock 'N' Roll.  The Spades represent the original 1950's era.  The Hearts represent the iconic 1960's era.  The Diamonds represent the 1970's era. The Clubs represent the 1980's-1990's rock era.   
More court cards will be revealed throughout the campaign.
 The Rock 'N' Roll Jokers feature a unique diptych design.
The Rock "N' Roll card back portrays the distinct identity of rock 'n' roll; featuring an original design inspired by the paisley bandanas worn by many legendary rockers.  Each of the circular, flower-like designs are made up of 12 small guitar silhouettes.  Together, the paisley designs form a mirror image of two skulls.  The skulls evoke the spirit of the rebel rocker who lives by a different set of rules. 
These are beautiful high quality custom black celluloid 0.80 gauge guitar picks. They are made in the USA by people who know how to rock! They are included (as a set of 3) in the $35 Reward tier, or can be added to any order for $5 (for a set of  2). 
 The Rock 'N' Roll Coin is a premium grade 2 inch dealer coin that comes in an antique silver finish. The best part....it doubles as a bottle opener! You can add it to any order for $9
        You may add as many items to your order as you would like.  Simply calculate the price of the items and add it to your pledge amount.  After the 30 day funding period, we will send you a Kickstarter survey to confirm your order.  
*We will not be using Backerkit so be sure to add everything you would like before the funding period ends.  
*Sticker Pack includes high quality stickers featuring artwork from the deck.   
My name is Ari Steffen. I work as a graphic artist and photographer. I have been a fan of playing cards for as long as I can remember. 
I enjoy card games and poker in particular. I decided to combine my skills as a graphic artist with my love of playing cards and when I finally stumbled across Kickstarter, everything fell into place. 
My wife and I had a great time with the entire process of creating and distributing Radical 80's Playing Cards (californiaplayingcards.com). We enjoyed interacting with Kickstarter, working with the USPCC and getting to know the playing card community. We enjoyed it so much in fact, we're back for more. 
We are excited to present Rock 'N' Roll playing cards through Kickstarter.  With your help, Rock 'N' Roll Playing Cards will become more than just a dream on my hard drive. By backing this project, you will help create the hardest rocking deck of playing cards in Bicycle's 129 year history. 
Thank you for being part of this project. For those about to pledge for Rock 'N' Roll Playing Cards; we salute you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second Kickstarter playing card deck. During my first project I established a working relationship with the United States Playing Card Co. I learned the ins and outs of Kickstarter and Amazon Payments. I became an expert in domestic and international shipping, and became very friendly with my local postmaster. Having been through the entire process, I know what it will take to bring the highest quality rewards to you in a timely manner. I will work tirelessly to overcome any obstacles that may arise. I will post regular project updates to keep you informed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Unfortunately Rock 'N' Roll Playing cards don’t have the momentum to get funded. We are over 1/2 threw the funding period and we are less then a third funded. I have decided to shut this project down and take a few months to reassess the design of rock in roll playing cards. This means none of you will be charged and Rock “N' Roll playing cards won't be made. I appreciate all of your support for this project, and will let you know if and when I relaunch.
Radical 80's decks will be on sale with free shipping in the USA and discounted international shipping for the next week at my store:

I have had some questions about the design and specifications of this deck. While some of this info is on the main page, I wanded to go over it in detail.
Rock 'N' Roll playing cards will be printed by the United States Playing Card Co. on Bicycle stock with an Air Cushioned or 'magic' finish. This means the cards have hundreds of dimples and a smooth coating that help them shuffle and fan well.
This deck will have the traditinal black and red suits. On my first deck (Radical 80's) I made a 4 color deck wich is great for poker because you can spot flushes easer, but not everyone plays poker, and it turns out many games don't work well with a 4 color deck. With that in mind I have designed Rock 'N' Roll playing cards to be the standard 2 color deck.

You Rock!
Thank you for being an early backer of Rock 'N' Roll playing cards! I am going to be announcing several new add ons and rewards over the coming week.
We are off to a great start, but we have a long way to go to get to 12K, and I have some big stretch goals planned. Together we will Rock the project. I would like to announce the Share The Rock Plan! I need your help spreading the word about this project, and I want to give you something for your effort. The Share The Rock Plan has 3 parts:

campaign.story:
In November 2013, we released the Gold deck. Over the weeks that followed, we received rave reviews and requests to design a red deck. Shortly after that, we traveled to the world's capital of luxury: Paris. The city's unique atmosphere and the haute couture inspired the creation of the Bicycle® Excellence. A masterpiece of pure elegance and sophistication.
The Bicycle® Excellence celebrates the beauty of Elite's craftsmanship. Premium tuck case made with highly reflective gold foil, metallic inks and more. Flawless finesse for professionals and collectors.
The back of the deck features a superb guilloché pattern and is infused with a deep gold metallic ink, specifically formulated for Elite.
The faces are graced with classic harmonious lines, and adorned by an exquisite gold gradient.
Fascinating from every angle, the Bicycle® Excellence is the result of months of dedicated design. It combines exceptional detail with the highest quality materials.
When you open a fresh pack of Bicycle® Excellence, the first thing you'll notice is the smooth finish of the cards. They are made from a linen textured stock and finished with a soft coating. They handle like silk. It feels smooth like velvet. Instead of ink, the design is created entirely from several layers of highly reflective gold foil.
   Deck Features:
Premium box made of Rich Red Vellum Paper and Gold Foil - stretch goal
100% custom art from the faces to the pips
Custom-made gold metallic ink - stretch goal
Linen Finish
Magic Coating (the cards handle smoothly and last longer than regular decks)
Limited edition closure seal - stretch goal
2 Gaff Cards with multiple uses
Embossed tuck case - stretch goal
Quality, durable, Bicycle® stock
Limited edition of 5.000 decks - will never be re-printed again
A limited edition luxury piece. Printed by the United States Playing Card Company/Bicycle®
ADD-ONS:
The following add-ons can be added to any of the backer levels. Just increase the amount of your existing pledge to get what you see in this section. Click here to see how to do it.
Bicycle® Excellence decks: $10
 Limited Edition
Signed Posters: $100
These fine luxury edition Signed Art Prints are produced on a specialist textured artist paper that makes the colors rich and vibrant. The Premium Glossy European paper and inks are color guaranteed for 70 years. Size: 8.3'' x 11.7''. Comes complete with a wood frame.
 Luxury Leather Cases: $100
Handcrafted to perfection in Italy, the Excellence Leather Cases are made with a soft premium Horween leather, for an unparalleled quality that lasts a lifetime. Each Leather Case is made to order exclusively for you, and takes two days to be finished. Only 10 will be made.
Excellence Card Cases: $35   
Made from High Quality Anodized Aluminum (the same material iPads are made of) the Excellence Cases are entirely made by a special laser process. These state-of-the-art Cases are guaranteed to last a lifetime and offer the best protection for your Excellence cards. Ultra light and highly resistant. Available in black, gold, and "red velvet" finish. The perfect match for your Excellence decks. They can be laser engraved with your own name. Contact us privately for more details.
Red Velvet Card Case:
Black/Gold Card Case:
Gold Card Case:
Excellence Gold Foil T-shirt: $25  
Our Luxury edition Excellence T-shirts, are made of high quality ultra soft cotton. In addition to exceptional comfort, the design is made of gold foil print, not ink. Affordable luxury, these heavy cotton t-shirts look and feel great. Wear your playing card love, with a premium t-shirt. Available in all sizes. Kickstarter exclusive.
 Collector's Excellence Poker sets: $200 - $690
Our Limited Edition Excellence Poker Sets made from rosewood, with the Excellence brand carved and filled in gold. The inside of the box is lined with soft black felt. Plus: professional casino quality ceramic poker chips, 2 autographed Excellence Decks, and 5 Dice. Available in 100 chips and 300 chips.
 Professional Casino Quality Ceramic Chips:
  Close up of the chips and dealer button:
 Limited Edition Collector's Luxury Rosewood Box: $150  
These Limited Edition Collector's Rosewood boxes are made from rare exotic imported Rosewood. Rosewood is used in luxury furniture and it's not widely available. The wood has a natural aromatic sweet smell that lasts for years. The Excellence brand is carved and filled in gold. The inside of the box is lined with soft black felt. Each box comes with 2 signed Excellence decks and 5 Dice. These boxes are a premium item for collectors and for this reason ONLY 5 will be available.
Excellence Collector's coin: $10
Made from steel with an antique gold finish, the Excellence coin is crafted in intricate detail exclusively for collectors. This is a limited edition of 300 coins only and available exclusively on kickstarter. A rare collector's piece that you’re likely to never see twice.
Excellence Dice Holder: $14
When we started designing the Excellence dice, we asked ourselves: how can we make a truly "excellence dice"? We have spent the past days designing several prototypes and refining the idea with our leather craftsman in Italy. This is the result. Gorgeous. Unique. And not available anywhere else in the world. Introducing the Excellence Dice Holder. Complete with 1 Dice Holder, 1 Burgundy Die and 1 Bordeaux Die.
Red Leather:
 Black Leather:
 Excellence Playing Cards Uncut Sheet: $40
These are pulled manually from the printing press in their most pure state: uncut. Can you imagine how your wall is going to look with one of these limited edition Uncut sheets? Each Uncut Sheet features 56 cards including jokers, aces, and gaff cards. The sheets are always printed in low quantities, thus rare. They are one of the most desired collector's item. Kickstarter exclusive. Limited Edition: only 50 available.
Stretch Goals:
We have planned some exclusive features and exciting new rewards for every funding benchmark we achieve.
Reaching $15K - The deck is funded and released ✓ Unlocked!
Reaching $20K - The Excellence dice will be released ✓ Unlocked!
Reaching $25K - The decks will be printed with metallic inks ✓ Unlocked!
Reaching $30K - The Excellence 18K gold plated ring will be released ✓ Unlocked!
Reaching $40K - The decks will come with a custom closure seal ✓ Unlocked!
Reaching $55K - The box will have highly reflective gold foil ✓ Unlocked!
Reaching $75K - The box will be manufactured with premium red vellum paper.
Reaching $90K - The box will be embossed
Reaching $100K - A rare limited edition white pearl version of the deck will be released.
About us:
We are a small team of people with background in Television, Product Development, Distribution, and Industrial Design. We love to design playing cards and we create them with passion. We only design playing cards that we would use, and we work everyday to bring our vision to life. We feel privileged to be able to share our work with you, and thank you for making this happen!
Funding: 
Your contributions will be used to print and manufacture the rewards of the Bicycle® Excellence deck. All of our products are 100% proudly made in the USA. We have great pride in supporting our economy by using american based manufacturing, and delivering rewards with unparalleled quality to our backers. Thank you for making this happen!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have had 8 successful projects funded here on kickstarter. Our last project: "Bicycle One Million deck" is currently being printed at the USPCC and we estimate to deliver it by May 2014.

There's nothing more important for us than getting your rewards delivered in a timely manner, and for that reason, we always ship our decks earlier than the estimated delivery date. We manufacture many the rewards ourselves and we rarely outsource. This ensures that we have control over the production, thus we always deliver in time. 

Without any delays from the printer (the United States Playing Card Company) we estimate to deliver the decks by August.

campaign.story:
The Plugged Nickel Playing Cards are not gone for good. We'll relaunch in a few months, so keep an eye on our site (www.vixentorgames.com) for info on joining the Facebook page or Twitter. More details will be coming as we have them!
Start with the Old West. Then add a little bite to it. Skeleton cowboys and barbed wire. Guns and dynamite. And a bullwhip.
The Plugged Nickel Playing Cards are a limited-print, specialty deck of cards printed by the United States Playing Card Company, so you know you're getting the same quality and finish you expect from the company that creates the world-famous Bicycle playing cards. There will be no second printing - once these decks are gone, they're gone for good.
Plugged Nickel Playing Cards - Rusted Tin Tuck Box
Plugged Nickel Playing Cards - Wanted Poster Tuck Box
  Dead Man's Hand - Wanted Poster
Dead Man's Hand - Rusted Tin
The highlights of the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards are the face cards. Each was specifically designed to resemble its traditional counterpart, from the angle of the head and pose of the body to the shapes found in the body of the card itself. The barbed wire, of course, is new.
Wanted Poster Clubs
Rusted Tin Clubs
Wanted Poster Diamonds
Rusted Tin Diamonds
Wanted Poster Spades
Rusted Tin Spades
Wanted Poster Hearts
Rusted Tin Hearts
 That does it for the courts, but I still have a few aces up my sleeve. Literally, aces. Not literally my sleeve, though. Next time I update here, I'll show off the aces, and before too much longer, we'll get to the jokers and the ad card.
I'm particularly excited about the ad card.
The piece de resistance, the feather in the cap of this Kickstarter, is the extremely limited card box. This wooden box is made of South American walnut that grows in an area prone to lightning strikes. The wood gets these cool black streaks from all the electricity being pulled up out of the ground.
The lid of the card box boasts the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards logo, carved right into the wood. This picture shows the lid and showcases the gorgeous burn marks that the lightning has made into the wood.
Card Box - Closed
The inside tray of the box is carved from a single piece of walnut, and has space to hold two decks, six dice and the dealer's coin. Here's a shot of the box with the lid up. The dice are just standard dice for now, but they will be the Plugged Nickel specialty dice in the finished product.
Card Box - Open
The card boxes are extremely limited. Only five will be available, and when they're gone, they're gone. These boxes will not be available after the Kickstarter ends. The boxes go for $150 each, and will come fully stocked with two decks of cards, a dealer's coin and six dice. These are not technically add-ons - they are available at the highest pledge level.
While the focus here is on printing the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards, and making them as great as they can be, we do have a few cool extras for you to add to your pledge.
There are three options for art prints. The first two are the card back and the Ace of Spades, from either the Rusted Tin or Wanted Poster deck, each available as a 20 X 30 giclee print. These are high-quality art prints, signed and numbered, printed on bright white archival paper. Each is available by adding $40 to your pledge.
Card Back Prints - 20 x 30
Ace of Spades Prints - 20 x 30
The third art print option is for a set of four 8 X 10 prints, this time of the four kings. These lords of cowboy poker will be proud to decorate your game room or office, whether you prefer the Wanted Poster look or the Rusted Tin. Like each of the art prints, these are high-quality giclee prints, signed and numbered, on bright white archival paper. You can add a set of the kings by adding $40 to your pledge.
Kings Prints - set of four 8 x 10
Personally, I can't wait to be holding an uncut sheet of the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards. There are two decks, so there are two sheets available. Each is available by adding $40 to your pledge ($80 for both of them).
Plugged Nickel Uncut Sheets
We've also got a few great bits for poker fans. First up is the dealer's coin. This is a heavy, 1.5" coin, 4mm thick. Obviously, the image below is an artist's rendering; the real coin will look even cooler. You can grab up one of these great coins by adding $10 to your pledge.
Plugged Nickel Dealer's Coin
Some custom dice will go nicely with your custom cards. These are engraved dice, bone-colored, with the insets painted black. Again, this is just a mockup. A pair of dice can be yours by adding $6 to your pledge.
Plugged Nickel Dice
The dice will be made by Dice Empire. They make a whole bunch of cool custom dice - you can see them here:
DICE EMPIRE
We will be using Backerkit to sort out the add-ons when the project is finished. Once the project closes, we will send out Backerkit surveys so you can tell us exactly what you want.
I don't just want to print a couple decks of cards. I want to print two of the coolest decks ever seen. I need $25,000 to cover postage and printing; everything after that will go to making the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards even more awesome.
The first improvement to the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards is a pretty obvious touch - at $30,000, we'll have custom seals on every deck.
The next upgrade after the custom seal will be to add embossing to the tuck box. This will make the design pop out, and give the deck a great tactile feel. We'll do that at $35,000.
Once the embossing is in the bag, I want to add copper metallic ink to highlight the art on the tucks. When we get to $40,000, both tuck boxes will get metallic ink.
Art on the inside of the tuck box is a really cool touch that you don't see with every deck. That will happen at $45,000.
To make the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards feel authentic, I want to use upgraded stock on the tuck box that will give it a rougher, more natural feel. We'll see that upgrade at $50,000.
The art card in the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards looks awesome - cool enough to hang on the wall. So when we hit $50K, every backer who is getting a deck of cards will get a postcard-sized version. And yeah, I'll sign every one of them.
I've got more ideas for interesting stretch goals, but let's not put the cart before the horse, shall we? When we get close to $55,000, I'll add some more stuff I would love to see happen with these decks.
The Plugged Nickel Playing Cards started out as just a creative impulse - I thought it would be fun to design a deck of cards. And it was. But after I designed a deck of cards, I wanted to play poker with them, and figured other people might want them, too. That means getting them printed, and the US Playing Card Company will make them look and feel great.
As I was adding color to the hand-drawn designs, I ended up with two very different looks. The problem was, I couldn't decide which I liked more. So I went with both. The decks share the same line art, but the similarity ends there.
The Wanted Poster deck is the closest in appearance to a traditional deck of cards, with colorful court cards and a relatively neutral background. I wanted it to look like, well, a wanted poster, so I went with sort of weathered paper texture.
The Rusted Tin deck is more of a departure from the everyday. The background resembles rusted metal, and every card has a red or dark brown background, depending on its suit. The face card art and pips are burned into the background, but with enough contrast to still stand out.
I also wanted cool pips, and since I was already doing barbed wire everywhere else, I thought, what the heck, let's go for broke. The pips on the cards are highly customized and all wrapped up in barbed wire. But at the same time, I have played poker with some custom decks, and let's face it, all that artsy-fartsy stuff doesn't mean a hill of beans if you can't tell what card you're holding. So the corner pips are essentially the old standby suits - but with a skull in the middle, because, you know, dead people.
I did start off with some art extending off the edges of the cards, but again, I've played poker with some of those custom decks, and that art can mark the cards and make it easy to tell where the face cards are hiding. Not only that, but after being a designer for 15 years, I know that dark colors at the edge of the card make chips and scratches show up and look ugly in a hurry. So while I did get pretty wacky with borders and barbed wire and skulls and what-not, I kept the edges white. You'll be able to play with these cards for a good long time.
A few other notes:
I'm digging the idea of Kicking It Forward, so to that end, I've agreed that 5% of what I make on this Kickstarter will be spent supporting other startup projects on Kickstarter. Which isn't that hard, really - I spend more than I should on Kickstarter as it is. You can read more about Kicking It Forward here:
KICKING IT FORWARD
Finally, I want to thank Cauhaus for providing the music in the video. The song is called Rednecks with White Faces, and it's channeling Johnny Cash if he was into vampire movies. You can hear the whole song here:
REDNECKS WITH WHITE FACES
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This might be my first Kickstarter, but it's not my first rodeo. I've owned VixenTor Games for seven years now, and have been a professional print designer since the 90s. Sure, things can go wrong, but I've allowed a wider delivery deadline than is strictly necessary so I can underpromise and overdeliver.

We could run into snags with the printer. Any good designer counts on it, even, and builds it into the timeline. If it happens, it won't be the first time a print project ran overbudget or past the print date. We stay flexible, deal with it, and hit our deadlines.

We could hit some issues with fulfillment. But again, I've done this before. I've shipped all over the globe, dealt with customs forms, ordered bulk pickups from the post office. I'm almost certain something will go wrong - but years of fixing my own mistakes has helped me learn how to deal with them, so if your order is broken, I'll make it my personal mission to make sure you're not just compensated. I want you happy.

The non-card rewards are another potential pain point. I'm not stamping the coins or building the card boxes. And working with new vendors means unpredictability - which is why I've already been in contact with those vendors and arranged fail-safes, including backups should the primary sources fall through.

One area we won't hit any problems is making the art. I've been working on these cards for nearly a year now, and this one is in the bag. The art is drawn, colored, refined, cleaned up, positioned and assembled. As soon as this Kickstarter project closes and I know how many decks we're printing, we're off to the races.

I figure there are other areas where this whole thing could hit a hiccup, and I won't know about them until they happen. That's the reason for the July delivery date - it gives me time to adjust if unforeseen complications throw me a curveball.

In short, there's nobody as excited to own a deck of the Plugged Nickel Playing cards as I am. I aim to make everything as smooth as possible, because this isn't just a business venture. It's personal for me, and so I've got a bigger stake than just money.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Matt Drake
3 created · 266 backed
Since I could hold a crayon, I wanted to be an artist. So I became a graphic designer and part-time illustrator, because that's a good way...See more

updates.update_content:
The new Kickstarter for the relaunched Plugged Nickel cards is live. Check it out and grab up the early birds before they're gone.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/786438508/plugged-nickel-playing-cards-printed-by-uspcc

We're less than five days from the relaunch of the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards, and I really appreciate you sticking around this long. Barring any unforeseen mixups, I'm planning on launching June 1st, around the middle of the afternoon. I'm thinking 1 PM CST.
So the big question up until now was, who was going to print these cards? And after lots of feedback and some back-and-forth with a handful of printers, I've decided for sure - the Plugged Nickel Playing Cards will be Bicycle-branded and printed by the USPCC.
I have been hearing from many of you who are looking forward to the relaunch, and I want to thank you for your patience. And I like to put my money where my mouth is, so when we do launch, we'll have a limited number of discounted early bird specials. We'll be posting updates at the Facebook page and the Twitter account, and the Prefundia page will let you know as soon as we go live. I'm offering lower prices for decks, all the way up to full bricks, so keep your eyes peeled and be ready when we launch!

It took a few days for the artists at Liberty to lay out the proofs, then it took two weeks from when I approved the proof before the cards were ready. So that's why I haven't said anything recently - not a whole lot to report. But now I'm sitting here fondling 24 shiny demo decks, and man are they pretty.
The next step is to send these decks out to people who will review them. I've lined up some pretty impressive people to take a gander, including professional magicians, card-slinging tricksters, and video reviewers. I'll be sending them out over the next few days, and will update here as the reviews come in.

Yeah, that was a Lone Ranger reference. For a deck about cowboys. It sort of works.
As I write this, the Wanted Poster deck is on its way to Liberty Playing Cards. Every card has been redesigned and tweaked, and I think they look a whole hell of a lot better. In a week or so, I ought to have some decks to send out to reviewers, so other people can see that Liberty makes some damned fine playing cards.
In the meantime, please enjoy some of these images from the redesign.

The redesign threads are posted at United Cardists and The Discourse. You can follow along, or, if you want, contribute some suggestions. I would really love to get a lot of feedback. The more people commenting and discussing the designs, the better they will be.
Here's the link to the thread at UC:
http://www.unitedcardists.com/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=4684

I'm calling this one. It would take a miracle to make another $16K in the next 16 hours, and I am not one to bank on miracles. But I am not done.
Here's my plan.
First, I'm going back to the design table. I'm going to take the deck over to the card forums, post them up and start on some fixes. One thing I heard a lot is that people aren't overly wild about the barbed wire borders, so I'll address that, as well as the pips. I'll also see what I can do to make the Rusted Tin deck more attractive - I had several comments that just plain hated that deck (and a whole bunch of people who wanted that one and not the Wanted Poster).
I said I would show off the jokers and the art card before this Kickstarter ended, and by gum, I mean to. So here you go, the jokers and the art card.

Good news first, because I hate delayed gratification.
I just picked up the card box from my woodworking guy this afternoon, and HOLY MACKEREL is it purty (I'm saying 'purty' because that's how they said it in the Old West). Here are pictures.

campaign.story:
Dia de los Muertos has always been a design inspiration for us. We feel no other holiday can match its pageantry and mystique, so it's fitting that our first Kickstarter campaign be an homage to this spiritual and cultural event. 
The Court Cards
With illustrations by David Edgerly - artist behind the successful Edgar Allan Poe Playing Cards Kickstarter project - we're representing Dia de los Muertos as it's celebrated today: full of color, detail and character. 
Spade Pips
The Card Back is ornately detailed but with a simple black and tarnished gold scheme that gives way to splashes of color from the Court Cards. We've added a weathered, parchment feel to the background in honor of Dia de los Muertos' historic roots. 
Card Back
The backers will have the chance to choose the fourth King in the deck, deciding between our "Priest" and "Artist" designs that we'll reveal as the campaign goes on. 
Sugar Skull Ace of Diamonds
El Matador King of Clubs
Catrina Queen of Hearts
Mariachi Jack of Spades
We'll be using the United States Playing Card Company to print the deck and any subsequent decks that are unlocked throughout our campaign; we found Dia de los Muertos so rich in material that we decided to offer different decks through stretch goals. We hope you'll help us unlock them all. 
The Black Deck - a black and white version of our main deck, with the red of the Hearts and Diamonds offering the one striking touch of color.
Unlock-able Black Deck
Black Ace and King
Black Queen and Jack
Black Card Back and Pips
And the Painted Deck, a surrender to the explosion of color that embodies Dia de los Muertos design at its boldest.
Painted Deck
Painted Deck Card Back and Court Cards
Painted Card Back and Pips
For Add Ons, we'll be offering Official Dice, Coins, Shot Glasses and T-Shirts. And a special Limited Edition, Signed, Custom-Sealed Unbranded Painted Deck.
Unbranded Painted Deck
Unbranded Painted Deck Custom Seal
Dice
Unlock-able Black Dice
Painted Dice
Coin
Silver Coin
Painted Coin
Sugar Skull Shot Glass - 2 oz. capacity, faceted base, custom engraved
Sugar Skull Spade Shirt
La Santa Muerte Shirt
Sugar Skull Spade Girly Tee
La Santa Muerte Girly Tee
PLAY

So, thanks for dropping by our page. We're beyond excited for this campaign, and over the next 35 days we hope to stay in constant communication with our backers so we can make this inaugural project a success!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've spent months analyzing countless playing card campaigns to prepare ourselves. There will be no problem meeting the artwork deadline as David Edgerly, our resident illustrator, has quite a bit of experience getting work submitted on time - and for some very picky clients, as we can personally attest.

We plan on using Backerkit to communicate with all backers who sign up to make sure their pledges are fulfilled quickly and efficiently. As for fulfillment centers, we've narrowed our selection down to a couple of houses that have extensive experience with Kickstarter projects, and before campaign's end we'll choose the one that is best able to meet our (and your) needs. 

As far as shipping goes, we try to be conservative in estimating costs, while not looking to make any profit for ourselves in the process. It's extremely difficult to know what each pledge will cost to fulfill, so we've tried to price in discounts throughout our pledge levels to pass on whatever savings to our backers we can. 

We're also conservative in estimating a fulfillment date, so our August deadline is a goal that we should easily meet. But unexpected things do happen, so rest assured we'll be issuing steady post-campaign updates to keep everyone informed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We wanted to say thanks again to everyone for their support and let you all know about our latest project, Edgy Brothers Presents!

campaign.story:
THANK YOU ALL for your amazing support which made the deck a reality and this campaign a huge success!
To pre-orded, visit: www.halfmoonplayingcards.com
"Grotesque" playing cards is a fully custom deck, which will be printed by the USPCC and designed by Lotrek, creator of "Bicycle Venexiana" :https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/709754364/bicycle-venexiana-deck-of-playing-cards-0?ref=live
This is the second deck of Half Moon Playing Cards, designed to be the first UnitedCardists Annual Deck.
The UC Annual Deck started as an idea to celebrate the change of ownership in UC. "The new UnitedCardists.com is now owned by a collector and friend of collectors along with "Friends of UC", not a company or business interest. Mike Ratledge of Charleston South Carolina took over ownership of UC in late 2013 after having been a moderator of the forums and bought out the previous owner, allowing the membership to direct the future of UC".
"Grotesque" is the result of this effort. With your help, it will become a reality!
A few words about "Grotesque"
The original meaning of 'Grotesque" was restricted to an extravagant style of Ancient Roman decorative art, rediscovered and then copied in Rome at the end of the 15th century. Since at least the 18th century (in French and German as well as English), grotesque has come to be used as a general adjective for the strange, fantastic, ugly, incongruous, unpleasant and thus is often used to describe weird shapes and distorted forms such as Halloween masks.
Although there is an immense variety of motifs and figures in Grotesque style, the three main tropes of the grotesque are doubleness, hybridity and metamorphosis.
During Renaissance, artists began to give the tiny faces of the figures in grotesque decorations strange caricatured expressions. In the 17th and 18th centuries the grotesque encompasses a wide field of teratology (science of monsters) and artistic experimentation.
Although grotesque art mainly favored the weird, ugly and monstrous, as an artist I try to bring "Grotesque" to my taste and make a deck which will be at the same time strange and beautiful.
I was always impressed by these haunting figures and about a year ago I decided to make some drawings for a deck called "Grotesque". After a year's nourishing, the deck finally came out and it's ready to begin its KS adventure!
As I did with "Venexiana", I'll be releasing the courts one by one during the campaign. I hope you'll enjoy the ride.
Here's a short interview about the deck to Ivan Choe from "kardify" which I hope you'll find interesting.
http://www.kardify.com/2014/02/kickstarter-7-questions-with-lotrek-of.html
Thank you,
Lotrek
"Grotesque" will be available in two editions: The "Original edition" and the "Limited edition". Each edition will have the same faces but different back. Both editions are going to be printed only once and won't be reprinted. So, what is the difference? Read below.
"Grotesque" Original Edition
O.E. tuck case design
The "Original Edition" is what the word says: It's how the deck was conceived. If after the campaign there are decks left. they will be available in the market until they're sold out.
"Grotesque" Limited  Edition
L.E. tuck case design
The "Limited Edition" will be available ONLY during the KS campaign and ONLY for KS backers. I will not wholesale after the end of the funding period. I'll produce only the number of decks needed to fulfill all rewards. However as one cannot  determine the exact number of decks coming out of he machine, there may be some decks left. Few of them will be for sale exclusively through my website but at a really unfriendly price. The rest will have the task of dust collecting in my closet. :-)
SIGNATURE EDITION
Signature edition is a very special one. It has tuck case hand crafted and assembled by me, with gold or silver foil , its own custom seal and a numbered certificate of authenticity signed and dedicated to the owner. Only 60 backers will get this edition which is available in gold (called signature gold) or silver foil (called signature platinum). Each backer can have both colors but not two of the same color. 40 backers have already gotten their decks and I'll release another 20 places 3 days before the end of the campaign. The cost is $60 per deck.
Signature edition Gold and Platinum uncut
- Standard USPCC stock, magic finish (Bee stock if $40K is reached)
- Embossing on the tuck case
- Casino quality "Bee" stock
- Custom seal on both editions
- Two-way back design
- 1 gaff card
- Limited edition.  These decks will never be reprinted.
"Original Edition" back design
"Limited Edition" back design
Ace of Spades
Ace of Diamonds
Ace of Hearts
King of Hearts
Queen of Diamonds
King of Clubs
Jack of Spades
Queen of Hearts
King of Diamonds
King of Spades
Queen of Clubs
Jack of Hearts
Queen of Spades
I will be uploading  the court cards throughout the campaign. The last  card will be up at the last day. Stay tuned!
At the bottom of the page there is a list with the Add-ons. Just add the corresponding amount to your pledge. After the end of the campaign you'll receive a survey where you'll be able to specify what items have you pledged for.
RUBIK'S CUBE!
A Unique ORIGINAL BRANDED Rubik's cube with "Grotesque" pictures! Only 100 pieces will be produced. Check preview here:
http://rubiksanimations.com/cube/United%20Cardist?_lang=en
http://rubiksanimations.com/cube/rotated/United%20Cardist?_lang=en
ART PRINTS
These are prints of the court cards and Aces. They're printed on 35cmX25cm fine quality hot pressed Saunders watercolor paper, signed and sent from Greece. This add-on will make more sense as the courts will start showing up. :-)
COINS
Rendering of the actual coin
Sample coin from the manufacturer
The coins have Antique bronze finish. Dimensions:  37,5mm diameter  2,5mm thickness.
ART BOOK
A very elegant 28page 21cm X 15cm booklet in full color, printed on a fine off-white paper, featuring on the left pages the original drawings and on the right pages the finished courts. Each copy will be signed. Available for $20 worldwide shipment included.
"Grotesque" leather folder with art prints
Don't be surprised, this is the folder from "Venexiana" project. It's essentially the same but with "Grotesque" logo instead of Venexiana. Hand crafted by me, with gold foil stamp on the front cover. The leather is goat, coming from the last traditional leather workshop in Greece. All prints are dated and signed.
 Signature Edition Uncuts
The S.E. tuck case uncuts will all be signed by the artist
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Those of you who have backed "Venexiana" already know that risks are below zero. Of course there is always the possibility of sudden madness! :-)

However, unforseen problems may occur and in such case we will be updating everyone regarding any delay in delivery of the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last few days for Russian Folk Art "Special Edition" and Collector's Edition
updates.update_content: Natalia Sylva is running a unique project, combining her previous talents from her original "Russian Folk Art" (red) deck previously Kick-started, with the latest new version "Special Edition" of Russian Folk Art along with the fabulous departure from her previous style with the "Collector's Edition" of no more than 75 decks, currently planned to be 50 printed.  The "Special Edition" is going to be made by United States Playing Card Co of Erlanger KY and the "Collector's Edition" is a special 310gsm spot UV tuck in a matte black with floral tones in the box design, and the cards are printed on a black background with both the original edition and the new edition cards mixed to create a unique "collector's crave" edition specifically for the serious collectors.  It is available still for $60, or $70 in a Carat Card Case™ (single) acrylic display case.  Here are some pictures of both decks, the green back being "Special Edition" and the gorgeous black with brightly colored inks is the "Collector's Edition".  You have about two days left to pledge for both - and the Collector's Edition is only available as an add-on to the basic project.  Her KS project is here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/393497409/russian-folk-art-special-edition?ref=GROTESQUE

Yesterday afternoon, we started funding the UnitedCardists.com 2015 ("UC2015") decks.  They are called "Delirium" and designed by Italian artist Giovanni Meroni of Thirdway Industries.
